Organizational Setting

The Animal Production and Health Division (NSA) promotes and facilitates the sustainable development of the livestock sector, integrating scientific, technical expertise and policy advice. It hosts technical networks in areas of animal genetics, feed and pastoralism, among others. It provides analysis and technical assistance, and facilitates policy dialogue (incl. intergovernmental bodies).

The consultancy is located in the Animal Production and Genetics Branch (NSAG). The Unit generates information and manages knowledge, facilitates the development and implementation of innovative solutions and provides technical expertise to improve productivity, efficiency and resilience of livestock production. The activities of the Unit cover all production systems, from pastoralism to industrial, including crop-livestock integrated systems; and aim to enhance their sustainability.

Reporting Lines

Under the direct supervision of the NSAG Animal Production Officer, and in close consultation and collaboration with relevant colleagues in FAO HQ and decentralized offices and partners, the incumbent will support NSAG’s work related to data collection for the Domestic Animal Diversity Information System (DAD-IS).

Technical Focus

Population size is a valuable indicator of a breed’s risk of extinction, which is used for the computation of SDG Indicator 2.5.2. Breed-based censuses and to a certain extent herdbooks for pedigree registration are accurate tools for monitoring breed population sizes, but are generally costly, require important logistic and governance capacities, and are not available for most breed populations in developing countries and for many breeds in developed countries, especially for certain species.

Estimating population size by sampling and/or other approaches is a relatively inexpensive approach that, when properly applied, still yields reasonably accurate results. FAO has already developed some methods for estimating population sizes of breeds and tested them in several countries. However, these methods are not appropriate in all circumstances, and further innovation is needed. Methods for estimating colony numbers are also needed to monitor the diversity of managed honey bees. The technical focus is on developing low-cost and cost-effective methods for estimating the size of breed populations in livestock species and the number of bee-colonies.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Provide a literature and technical review of methods on estimation of breed population sizes including the one developed by FAO based on stratified-sampling considering the desired precision of estimates, the degree of accuracy and related costs.
Participate in one mission to FAO HQ to meet relevant colleagues and partners.
Develop a structured questionnaire that helps to collect information on implementation constraints, challenges experienced, and solutions found related to collection/estimation of breed population size data. This should be based on the literature review developed under the first bullet.
Conduct structured interviews (online or onsite) to gather information on implementation constraints, challenges experienced, and solutions found related to collection/estimation of breed population size data.
Based on the literature review and through the analysis of the information collected through the task above, prepare a document presenting alternative methods to estimate population sizes of breeds and the number of bee colonies for monitoring purpose, describing prerequisites for implementation and costs in relation to precision and degree of accuracy of the estimates.
Draft a step-by-step guide on the implementation of selected alternative low-cost methods in the field.
Assist in identifying countries and Service Providers for testing the proposed methods in the field.
Perform other duties as required.

CANDIDATES WILL BE ASSESSED AGAINST THE FOLLOWING

Minimum Requirements

University degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, agricultural economics, or a related field with training in statistics.
Five years of relevant field experience in statistical surveys and censuses.
For Consultants: working knowledge of English and limited knowledge of French, Spanish, Arabic, Chinese or Russian. For PSAs: working knowledge of English.

FAO Core Competencies

Results Focus
Teamwork
Communication
Building Effective Relationships
Knowledge Sharing and Continuous Improvement

Technical/Functional

Extent and relevance of knowledge and experience in census and survey methodology.
Extent and relevance of experience in designing, planning and managing large-scale surveys and/or censuses.
Work experience in more than one location or area of work, particularly in low and middle-income countries.
Extent and relevance of experience in the preparation, editing and revision of technical/scientific/project documents;
Extent and relevance of knowledge and experience in software used for processing and analysing census/survey data;
Extent of experience in providing support to countries for technical assistance in statistics;
Demonstrated capacity to write technical content in English;
Excellent communication and inter-personal skills;
Familiarity with the Domestic Animal Diversity Information System (DAD-IS) and the SDG indicators under SDG target 2.5 is an asset.

Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.




Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.




Who We Are…




When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…




From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.




The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Games family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same: to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. Our team is comprised of dedicated professionals with years of experience who are at the forefront of the gaming industry. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room.




The Job




As a junior associate software engineer, you’ll work remotely from your home, or from our legendary Chicago studio, helping our senior analytics engineer build out the technical infrastructure for data analytics on our next AAA mobile game.




You’ll be responsible for development, maintenance and testing of both client and server-side analytics events for thousands of daily active users. You’ll help gather requirements from the design and product team and turn those requirements into implementation. You’ll learn about the pipeline for a modern mobile game, finding yourself working in purchase code one day, and combat code the next.




The Daily




Meet with designers and product managers, finding out what they need to know about player behavior.
Meet with data analysts, determining the type and format of data needed to answer player behavior questions.
Work with the senior analytics engineer to determine how best to implement analytics in-game, given the requirements




The Essentials




Experience in the C++ language
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills
Genuine interest in writing code that’s clean and clear
Great communication skills, especially through remote-oriented tools like Slack or Zoom
Passion for learning and growing; asking for help when you need it




The Nice to Haves




Familiarity with SQL
Experience with UnrealEngine4.
Experience with mobile platform languages like Objective-C or Java
Experience with TypeScript or JavaScript




How We Get Things Done…




This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.




The Legal Bits…




Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.




If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@warnermedia.com.

Job_title: Training Coordinator for Disney Community Website NY
Job_description:
Hello, Training Coordinators!

My name is Kurt Schmidt and I am a serial entrepreneur. I'm the owner of Inside The Magic and looking for a rockstar training coordinator to join our team.

About the company:

Inside the Magic is the number #1 site online for Walt Disney World, Disneyland, Universal Studios, and more. Plus movie news for all of your favorite Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars films, covering the most interesting, entertaining, and unique entertainment experiences in the worlds of theme parks, movies, TV, video games, conventions, special events, and so much more.

About the role:

We are looking to hire a motivated Training Coordinator who will be responsible for delivering instruction and training to ensure that the company staff have the necessary skills, education and knowledge. You will be in charge of developing curricula, recommending programs, formulating training outlines and determining instructional methods.

You will also be responsible for performing administrative functions necessary to deliver and document training programs. Furthermore, you will be required to evaluate the effectiveness of training and development programs, using relevant evaluation data to make revisions or recommend changes to instructional objectives and methods. Lastly, you will be responsible for analyzing and assessing training and development needs.

This is also a rewarding position as it allows you to be a part of the development of staff and their growth.

This would be a Full-Time Remote position

We are looking for someone in the US time zones.

Responsibilities (but are not limited to):

Delivers group and individual instruction and training covering to ensure staff have all the information, skills, education and knowledge necessary to accurately perform assigned duties
Develops training curricula and/or recommend programs that meet instructional goals and objectives
Formulates training outlines and determines instructional methods, utilizing knowledge of specified training needs
Coordinates or performs administrative functions necessary to deliver and document training programs
Evaluates the effectiveness of training and development programs and utilize relevant evaluation data to revise or recommend changes in instructional objectives and methods.
Analyzes and assesses training and development needs
Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned


Please note that you’ll be joining a fast pace and high-achieving team. You’ll be held to high expectations and challenged. And you’ll also be supported in your growth in this role professionally as well as personally.

If this sounds interesting to you please proceed to the application.

Requirements

3+ years of experience in delivering training sessions and individual instruction to employees
Experience in teaching, training, or instructional design
Experience in organizing and documenting training processes
Degree in education, instructional design, organizational development, or a related field
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Organizational skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Analytical skills


Benefits

Work with a talented team
Completely remote schedule
Location independence

Responsibilities:




Work on initiatives to drive growth. Partner closely with Analytics, Data engineering and Instrumentation teams. Work falls broadly into 3 areas: Foundational: Work with engineering to identify data needs for new initiatives and make sure the data pipeline is built. Partner with instrumentation team to ensure tracking is in place before launches
Reporting and Measurement: Identify, measure and communicate KPIs for overall business and key initiatives. Build and maintain regular reports and provide ad-hoc analysis to support business needs
Business Advisory: Identify key learnings from data and distill findings into recommendations for business owners

TOP SKILLS

Business understanding. Experience with growth or product analytics is a plus.
Ability to structure and solve problems
SQL, R or Python
Communication skills to package findings
Work well within cross-functional teams
Bachelors or Masters in the fields of Statistics, Commerce, Business Analytics, Applied Mathematics
At least 2 years of experience, preferably in a consumer tech company or a subscription business.






Compensation:

The estimated pay range for this position is USD $60.00/Hr - USD $65.00/Hr and is a/an Non-Exempt/Exempt role. Exact compensation and offers of employment are dependent on circumstances of each case and will be determined based on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, licenses or certifications, and location.




Benefits:

We offer comprehensive benefit options which vary depending on role, location, and employment type. Benefit options may include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, Parental Leave, Paid Time Off, and Holidays. The Talent Acquisition Partner can share more details about compensation or benefits for the specific role during the hiring process.

We are working exclusively with our client in locating a Business Data Analyst to support their Transformation Office (TO). In this role you will define and measure success for our client’s transformation initiatives. You will be responsible for calculating baseline measures using existing data, recommending methods to capture new data streams, setting KPIs and targets, and reporting on progress. You will also be engaged with assessing organizational maturity on key agility competencies as well as employee’s mindset and behaviors as it pertains to transformation initiatives.




Key Responsibilities

Define the KPIs and methods for data capture and reporting to demonstrate progress towards transformation outcomes, such as increased flexibility, faster decision making, greater transparency
Develop dashboards and reports that enable the TO team and executives to assess progress in real-time
Use data analysis, survey data, and qualitative methods to gather insights to identify root causes or to better clarify problem statements, in support of transformation initiatives
Support Transformation Office leaders in defining KPIs, data strategy, and reporting mechanisms for specific transformation projects
Partner with strategy and planning offices in Product, Sales, Technology, Finance, and Client Services to create alignment on metrics, KPIs and reporting
Work with the Enterprise Agility team to capture maturity assessments across functions and regions
Develop predictive models or conduct deep analyses to assess drivers and barriers to optimizing customer experiences, generating revenue, other business outcomes




Qualifications:

5+ years of work experience with a bachelor’s degree or at least 3 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g., Master’s, MBA, JD, MD)
Degree in an analytical field such as statistics, mathematics, business analytics, economics, computer science or similar (advanced analytics or business degree a plus)
Experience using statistical and modeling software (e.g. Python, R, SAS, SPSS, Stata)
Familiar with extracting and aggregating large data sets using SQL and/or Excel
Data visualization experience using Business Objects and/or Tableau
An out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming innovative ways to use data to answer business problems
Thrives in an environment that is fast-paced, rapidly changing, and customer service-oriented
Familiarity with Agile principles, Lean Thinking, or Change Management methods a plus




Start: ASAP

Duration: 6+months (with possible extensions)

Hours: 40 hours per week

Location: 100% Virtual




NOTE: 100% Virtual Positions

Job_title: Senior Analyst, Fit & Wear Testing, Footwear
Job_description:
San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR | Product Development Team | Reports to Senior Director, Product Development

COVID-19: Allbirds requires all US-based Corporate employees who enter an Allbirds-owned or operated Corporate facility to demonstrate proof of receiving a COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of their employment, subject to exemptions for sincerely held religious beliefs, or valid medical reasons.

Who is Allbirds?

At Allbirds, we believe in using business as a force for good. We're a global footwear and apparel brand with roots in New Zealand and headquarters in San Francisco. Since 2016, we've been on a mission to prove that comfort, design, and sustainability aren't mutually exclusive. Our commitment to creating better things in a better way is fueled by a belief that the fashion industry needs to focus less on flash and more on thoughtfulness. We're a certified B Corporation, meaning we meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency. We're dedicated to making the most sustainable products we can using premium natural materials - designed for life's everyday adventures. In fact, TIME 100 named us for being one of the most innovative companies. Already calling our first shoe, the Wool Runners, the most comfortable in the world, and there is much more to come.

We take our craft seriously, but not ourselves. As part of the Allbirds family, you can look forward to team lunches, product tests, fun company events, inspiring guest speakers, comfortable shoes, sheep puns, and lots of creative ideas.

Where we need help

The footwear development team is the central hub where Allbirds' shoes become a reality. Our team is looking for a tenacious, highly organized, and well-rounded go-getter to join us in leading all things related to product fit, performance, comfort & organization. The footwear team has the special privilege and responsibility of bringing exceptional, thoughtful, and sustainable products to our consumers. We strive to deliver super natural comfort in each of our footwear products and the input from our fit/wear testers partners is critical to our success. Our team is looking for someone who can immediately make an impact on our fit & wear testing program by using their experience to build on and improve our current process. Our ideal candidate will have experience recruiting testers & managing quarterly fit/wear tests for both lifestyle and performance footwear products. They should be a self-starter who is comfortable working cross-functionally with the ability to clearly communicate areas of product improvement based on data analysis gathered during the fit/wear process. Come join a small team striving to make the world's most comfortable shoes and have an immediate impact!


What does the job entail?

Partner with cross-functional project teams - including development, design & product strategy - to design comprehensive test plans for each model across both Lifestyle and Performance footwear categories.
Recruit and build a solid network of authentic tester relationships across various geos, activities, and consumer segments using MESH01.
Lead multiple rounds of onsite & remote product testing to analyze fit, comfort, performance, & durability of each product to ensure delivery of world class footwear product.
Demonstrate excellent ability to collect and analyze tester feedback, identify trends in tester data, perform durability inspections, write reports, and elevate findings to key stakeholders and cross-functional teammates.
In collaboration with footwear development, build a strong understanding of footwear components, technologies & manufacturing processes to effectively identify technical footwear issues and suggest solutions.
Ability to think both creatively and analytically with excellent collaboration and problem-solving skills.
Deliver product feedback on time with the go-to-market calendar and lead discussions from the product testing point of view during cross-functional product reviews.
Manage information & data collection processes using digital tools such as Google Drive, MSOffice, MESH01, Centric PLM, BOX, Asana and others.


What are we looking for?

Deep passion for product development, sustainable materials, and footwear
Experience in biomechanics and/or footwear construction
Likes being hands-on and working with physical product
Proactive attitude and behavior
Detail oriented and clear communicator
Keen curiosity and critical thinking
Process oriented
Not afraid to ask appropriate questions, poke holes, and make well-informed decisions
Results driven in a team-based environment
Fast learner when using new software tools
Someone who isn't afraid to roll up their sleeves


More practical skills needed:

2+ years in footwear product testing or production creation.
BA/BS or equivalent, a plus if in biomechanics, kinesiology or industrial design/engineering.
Experience with survey design utilizing both quantitative and qualitative research methods with proven ability to analyze data and provide actionable feedback to cross-functional partners, MESH01 experience a plus.
Solid understanding of footwear development and manufacturing processes with a willingness to learn about cutting edge materials.
Exceptional project management experience to maintain focused deliverables while managing multiple competing priorities.
Quick, adaptive, and robust communication skills with the ability to take complex feedback and distill it to the key takeaways to inform decision making processes related to product fit, performance, comfort & durability.
Experience working both independently and collaboratively.


What can we offer?

Competitive salary + equity
Medical / Dental / Vision insurance
401k employer match
Paid parental leave
Wellness Benefits
Employee Discount
Commuter Benefits
Student Loan Repayment Program


Please apply with your resume and cover letter. We're excited to hear from you.

Diversity

Allbirds is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Allbirds policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religious creed, sex, gender identity, marital or veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member), sexual orientation, pregnancy, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. It also prohibits discrimination based on a perception that anyone has any of those characteristics, or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics. All such discrimination is unlawful.

Overview

At Criterion Systems, we developed a different kind of business—a company whose real value is a reputation for excellence built upon the collective skills, talents, perspectives, and backgrounds of its people. By accepting a position with Criterion Systems, you will join a group of professionals with a collaborative mindset where we share ideas and foster professional development to accomplish our goals. In addition to our great culture, we also offer competitive compensation and benefit packages, company-sponsored team building events, and advancement opportunities. To find out more about how Criterion can help you take your career to the next level please visit our website:www.criterion-sys.com.

Responsibilities

Criterion Systems is seeking a PowerBI Developer to be part of a newly awarded contract supporting a high visibility project focused on integrating disparate data sources from both cloud and on-premise environments into Microsoft PowerBI.

The successful candidate will be responsible for creating visually appealing, interactive dashboards and reports that effectively communicate insights from the integrated data sources to stakeholders.

As An PowerBI Developer, You Will
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand business requirements and data sources.
Design and develop visually appealing and interactive dashboards and reports that effectively communicate insights from integrated data sources.
Develop and maintain the PowerBI data model, including data relationships, hierarchies, and calculated measures.
Develop and maintain custom visuals and templates in PowerBI.
Develop and maintain PowerBI reports that are optimized for performance and scalability.
Develop and maintain documentation of PowerBI reports and dashboards.
Operate and maintain Executive Dashboards, troubleshoot errors, and continuously improve automated audit and dashboard capabilities
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and incorporate feedback into dashboards and reports.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications and Experience:
Active DoD TS/SCI Clearance
DoD 8570 IAT II Certification or higher (e.g., Security+, CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, CND, SSCP) https://public.cyber.mil/cw/cwmp/dod-approved-8570-baseline-certifications
BA/BS in Engineering, Computer Science or related field
4+ years of experience, including 2+ years designing and developing PowerBI (or similar) dashboards and reports.
Strong experience in data visualization, data modeling, and custom visual development in PowerBI
Expertise in DAX, including complex formula design and optimization.
Experience with SQL, including complex query design and performance tuning.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Criterion Systems, LLC. is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination at all levels of our organization. We believe in treating all applicants and employees fairly and make employment decisions without regard to any individual’s protected status: race, ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, creed, sex/gender, gender identity/gender expression, sexual orientation, physical and mental disability, marital/parental status, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), age, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit https://careers-criterion-sys.icims.com/.

Dev10, a division of Genesis10, takes college graduates with the passion and aptitude to be entry-level software developers or data engineers and provides hands-on training and client project experience all within a full-time paid position. No prior coding experience is required. Dev10 Consultants work on exciting projects for Fortune 500 companies. To learn more about our roles within Dev10, please visit us at http://www.dev-10.com/.

NO C2C / ONLY GC/USC




Business Data Analyst (Clinical)

Great Neck New York 11021}

Hours: 40 hrs

Length: 3-6 month contract

Hybrid - So NEED LOCALS







Duties and responsibilities

Explore and summarize health system data to provide insight for strategic decisions.
Implement applications, tools, and processes that assist clinicians with the management of data in patient care and the provision of health care
Liaise with service lines and technical teams to translate complex business and technology specifications into relatable concepts to expedite communications and project execution
Recommends innovative ideas, processes, and/or procedures for enhancements, additions, and modifications to improve existing systems
Assists in the creation of product roadmaps
Work with other members of the team to implement solutions to meet business operation needs
Participates in support activities that may include issue tracking, issue resolution, documentation, capacity planning, and functional testing and quality assurance
Prepares standard operating procedure documentation related to the assigned application for the purposes of operational support and cross-training




Skills




Knowledge of SQL is required
Experience with Python, Powerbi or other visualization tools is a plus.
Detail oriented and skilled in complex problem solving
Capable of addressing issues using a combination of existing system functionality and custom developed tools.
Experienced in clinical systems implementations and support
Ability to learn custom-developed systems and complex workflows quickly in order to support job responsibilities
Skilled in all Microsoft Office applications (Word, Power Point, Excel, Visio etc.)
Ability to review, categorize, and analyze clinical data
Ability to work independently, exercise creativity, and maintain a positive attitude
Ability to manage multiple and simultaneous responsibilities and to prioritize scheduling of work
Ability to complete work assignments accurately and in a timely manner
Ability to communicate effectively, with excellent verbal and written communication skills




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in healthcare information, information science, computer science or business administration, required
Minimum of Three (3) years' experience in a technical support, business analysis or project management role in a clinical or healthcare environment
Knowledge of healthcare policies and procedures, including HIPPA, PCI, required

Delivers a high level of competency in student information management and compliance of state-mandated reporting. Assesses and performs analysis on data, and prepares data to facilitate and assist in ensuring compliance with state-mandated reporting functions of the organization. Responsibilities require understanding of both theory and practice.




Collaborates with supervisor and other District staff to develop short and long-range plans for assigned program or functional area.
Researches and explores feasibility of implementing new methods, technologies or programs.
Develops, schedules, implements, monitors and evaluates all programs, projects and operations in area of responsibility.
Researches, compiles data for, and prepares various statistical, administrative and/or financial reports as required.
Implements procedures for monitoring, analyzing and determining appropriate corrective actions to ensure accurate student information system (Powerschool SMS) data and Educational Information System (EIS) data.
Provides group and one-on-one training and support to school and District personnel in the use of the student information system, its related components, and EIS; prepares training instructions and manuals.
Assists in resolving class-size issues with school principals as necessary; collaborates as needed with appropriate District departments/divisions in resolving discrepancies in student reporting to the SDE.
Performs other duties as assigned.




Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in Education, Computer Science, Information Technology or Information Management, or a related area plus an additional 2 years related experience, or equivalent, for a total education/experience of 6 years. Valid state driver's license required.




Degree Equivalency Formula




Bachelor’s Degree= 4 years plus required years of experience.




Master’s Degree= 2 years plus required years of experience. Where Master’s degrees are required, years for Bachelor’s Degrees must be included.




Strong analytic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to swiftly and accurately understand complex data and perform analysis
Skill in developing data-supported solutions and using fact-based logic; ability to translate complex analysis in easy-to-understand manner and present to a broad audience
Knowledge of theories, principles, and concepts of data management, information systems management or related field
Ability to interpret and apply state mandated reporting requirements regarding students and staff
Skill in applying analytical, investigative, and evaluative methods
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to tackle the operational challenges of the merged school district in a complex, changing political and educational environment
Ability to manage daily administrative tasks without losing sight of long-term goals and planning




Physical Demands Requires sedentary work involving standing or walking for brief periods, exerting up to 10 pounds of force on a regular basis; and some dexterity in operating office equipment; must be able to use hands and fingers for sign language.




Unavoidable Hazards The position is exposed to no unusual environmental hazards.




Sensory (ADA) Requirements The position requires normal visual acuity and field of vision, hearing and speaking abilities.




Americans With Disabilities Act Compliance




Shelby County Schools is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ADA requires the district to provide adequate accommodations to qualified persons with disabilities. Prospective and current employees are encouraged to discuss ADA accommodations with management.

AdTheorent is a technology company that is transforming advertising through data-driven predictive solutions. AdTheorent's machine learning, tracking and deep linking technologies combine to maximize engagement and awareness for advertisers. Our exceptional technology and solutions - conceived and developed in house - are a source of pride for our entire team. AdTheorent's culture is inclusive with targeted emphasis on the value and contributions of each employee. We work hard to communicate with each employee about his or her career trajectory and options for professional development, and the state of the business in general.








Position Overview:



AdTheorent is currently seeking a Digital Strategist to join its team. This individual will support the West Coast Sales teams by leading brainstorming sessions to help crystallize ideas into actionable campaign solutions for advertisers, and by developing customized proposals, sales decks, client templates and vertical materials.








Responsibilities:



Day-to-day support of Sales team through development of proposal decks, client templates and sales deliverables
Work alongside Creative, Sales, and Client Services to ensure optimal and timely proposal delivery of all materials
Own pre-sales plan pricing, inventory forecasting, and plan revisions
Work with the Sales team to keep Salesforce fully up to date and the pipeline current
Build and maintain positive communication between internal teams
Support Sales team during client calls, in-person meetings and entertainment events
Work closely with other members of the Strategy team to balance resources and to ensure success for the entire organization


Must Haves:



Exceptional interpersonal skills on the phone, via email, and in person
2-3 years of experience in similar position in the media/ad-tech space (i.e. media planner at digital media agency, sales planner at a digital publisher, ad network, etc.)
A self-starting mindset, with the ability to make decisions quickly and react to a changing environment
Deadline driven and organized, with good project management skills
A strong grasp of PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel
Knowledgeable of the latest digital advertising trends and online media



Benefits



We offer full health coverage, generous PTO, an award-winning office culture.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to foster community, inclusion, and diversity within the organization. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of racial, religious, sexual or gender identity, to apply.

Job Description

Janssen Pharmaceuticals, a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for two Data Analytics Co-ops for Titusville, New Jersey.

At Johnson & Johnson, we use technology and the power of teamwork to discover new ways to prevent and overcome the world’s the most significant healthcare challenges. Our Pharmaceutical teams leverage data, real-world insights, and creative minds to make life-changing healthcare products and medicines. We're disrupting outdated healthcare ecosystems and infusing them with transformative ideas to help people thrive throughout every stage of their lives. With a reach of more than a billion people every day, there’s no limit to the impact you can make here. Are you ready to reimagine healthcare?

The Co-Ops in Data Analytics are responsible for supporting the execution of ad hoc analyses, automated performance dashboards, and Management reports across the Janssen Neuroscience and Infectious Diseases/Vaccines Portfolio of products. This position will support the Commercial Insights & Strategy team through the accurate and timely synthesis and delivery of multiple secondary data sources. Additionally, this position will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity of the data through collaborations (with internal and external partners), data investigations, and adherence to strict QC processes.

The Data Analytics Co-op position is available at Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson located in Titusville, New Jersey.

The Co-op Program is a six-month program (planned for June 19 - December 22, 2023) focused on providing college students with practical business experience. It allows students to develop leadership, technical, and communication skills as well as broaden their understanding of the concepts learned in the classroom by implementing them with the Johnson & Johnson data analytics team.

Key Responsibilities

Ad hoc analyses utilizing secondary data sources
Process and analyze performance trends through automated dashboards
Collaborate with key internal and external partners on national and subnational reporting deliverables
Conduct deep dives and targeted analytics to answer critical business questions that arise from the weekly and monthly performance results
Analytical mindset and comfort conducting analyses using large amounts of data is required
Proficiency with Microsoft applications (Excel, PowerPoint) is required
Experience utilizing dashboards and data visualization software (Tableau and/or Dataiku) is preferred but not required
Experience in pharma data (patient, physician, claims, etc.), data integration, and pharma analytics/metrics is preferred but not required
Permanent US work authorization without the need for sponsorship now, or in the future (F1 or H1B requires sponsorship in future)
Have a cumulative GPA of 2.8 or higher, which is reflective of all college coursework.
Be currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree.
Ability to work full time (40 hours a week) ~ June 2023 through December 2023
Commit to a June 2023 Co-Op start date
By start date, must be considered an undergraduate sophomore or above


The anticipated base pay for this position is between $22.75/hour and $29/hour, but will be based on candidate’s program year, discipline, degree and/or experience. This position is overtime eligible. Interns may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as medical insurance, sick time, and holiday pay in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans.

For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: - https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

NA-US-New Jersey-Titusville

Description

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking a talented Business Analyst Intern, located in Reston, VA who is ready to apply knowledge of business practices and processes in a fast-paced, real-world environment. The intern will assist in writing reports, conducting research, analyzing data, budgeting, and forecasting, gathering requirements, and making recommendations to improve project cost effectiveness and efficiency. This will be a valuable experience for any student pursuing a career in business administration or strategic communications.

At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business. If this sounds like a mission you want to be a part of, keep reading!

Every position we take is more rewarding when you know the why behind it. Know your work makes a difference to support those who need it most. If your passion is enabling life changing service to those around you this is the place for you. Find you passion in a team environment where all members are valued regardless of contractor or employee status. We are excited for you to take your place in our Leidos Family.

Find your “Why” with us!

Primary Responsibilities

Analyze business goals, objectives, and needs
Help plan and design business processes and make recommendations for improvement
Perform research and analysis in support of operations
Assist in resolving business and financial issues using systems and data
Estimate costs and benefits of multiple actions and/or solutions and provide recommendations
Help launch new initiatives
May perform additional projects upon request

Basic Qualifications

Must be pursuing Master's Degree in in Business administration, Communications, or relevant degree
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Experience with Microsoft Office
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Good analytical skills including data and financial analysis
US Citizenship required

Pay Range

Pay Range $46,800.00 - $72,000.00 - $97,200.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

SENIOR - Threat Finance Analyst




DarkStar Intelligence is seeking experienced Threat Finance Analysts to serve as Financial Intelligence Experts supporting financial intelligence threats to U.S. Army Investigations and Operations. Threat Finance Analysts conduct research, threat financial analysis, and financial forensics examination of counterintelligence, counter-terrorism, force protection, and information operations of foreign military forces, and their operations, capabilities, activities and trends to support investigations and operations. Analysis topics include specific foreign financial activities including threat financiers, facilitators, and financial networks/operations associated with terrorism, CD, narco-terrorism, counterintelligence, insurgency, proliferation, and operational activity that threatens U.S. national security interests.




Responsibilities




Conduct threat financial intelligence research and all-source analysis of data in order to provide threat financial intelligence products, briefings, assessments on threat financiers, facilitators, and financial operations and networks associated with counterintelligence, cyberspace domain, terrorism, insurgency, proliferation, and nation state adversaries.
Extract and fuse transactional data from all sources to provide value-added analysis and products to support investigations, operations, and key decision makers.
Provide threat financial analytic support to an investigative team.
Perform analysis of financial data from formal banking system, financial reports, and informal systems for moving money.
Assist with evaluating financial data to identify and analyze potential money and micro laundering indicative of espionage, insider threat, cyber finance and noted counterintelligence financial intelligence indicators.
Analyze threat financial intelligence information to assess developments, trends, and threat implications.
Provide advice on techniques and innovative methods employed in threat analysis and projection.
Plan, coordinate, and synthesize research from other analysts to prepare all-source financial and counter threat finance intelligence products and responses.




Requirements




MA + 12 years of experience OR BA + 17 years of experience
Minimum 5 years of counterintelligence experience.
Minimum 5 years of all-source analytic experience.
Minimum 3 years of Financial Intelligence experience.
Experience in preparing and integrating financial data from sources including, but not limited to SIGINT intercepts; HUMINT; Law Enforcement Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA), search warrants and subpoenas; DOMEX, and shared data such as Bank Secrecy Act, formal banking system, Suspicious Activities Reports, and informal systems.
Experience applying pattern analysis to large data sets.
Experience applying intelligence collection requirements, essential elements of information, priority intelligence requirements, and search terms to DOMEX triage processes.
Experience applying data engineering to interface with structured data and data forensics tools.
Knowledgeable in applying statistical techniques including flows analysis, visualization, and geospatial analysis tools to bulk and raw transactional data.
Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (ACAMS) certification required. Equivalent certifications may be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Did you realize too late in your degree program that you wished you had pursued technology?

This job posting is for a Dev10 position that requires you to agree to relocate anywhere in the United States.

Logic & reasoning skills
Communication skills

Job Description:




A Data Engineer, or Data Systems Engineer, is responsible for developing and maintaining data processing software like databases. Their duties include coordinating with company Executives and other professionals to create unique data infrastructure, running tests on their designs to isolate errors and updating systems to accommodate changes in company needs.




Data Engineer Duties And Responsibilities




In addition to creating and maintaining an optimal pipeline architecture, typical duties and responsibilities for a Data Engineer position may include:




Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements
Identifying, designing and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes
Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using AWS and SQL technologies
Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition
Working with stakeholders including data, design, product and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues
Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues

Collaborates with customer service, shipping/receiving, and other departments as needed.

Other duties as assigned.

E-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Data Manager to lead our team in the processing, loading and quality checking the marketing leads we acquire and add to our database.

These qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. You will have the important job of managing the processes and staff that are responsible for the capture, completion, and accuracy of all marketing prospects added to our system. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage the acquisition, validation, tagging, and formatting of new email marketing prospects.
Work closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and results
Coordinate between departments to ensure deadlines are met
Prioritize data so that the highest quality prospects are processed first
Meet monthly volume and accuracy goals
Front-line management of data processing team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)
Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loading
When needed, jump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are met
Solve problems as they arise to keep prospects moving

Experience: 3+ years’ experience as data project manager (or similar job), preferably supporting marketing functions
Computer: EXCELLENT MS Excel skills

Change: Ability to shift gears quickly.

Management: Strong problem-solving, multitasking and prioritization skills. You never give up.
Communications: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Auditing: Ability to utilize key indicators to identify problems – then take action to resolve.
Strategy: Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve speed and accuracy.

Company Core Values: Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results

Our entire team moves fast and never shies away from a challenge. We are definitively a glass entirely full group. This doesn’t mean that we have our heads in the clouds. We live in reality, driven by data and numbers. When mistakes happen (which they do), we own them. Then, we use what we’ve learned and do it right the next time. We respect each other, but say what needs to be said. We work hard so we can have a balanced life. With that said, when we are here we are results-oriented and driven.

This role is a chance to use your talent and expertise to make a visible difference in our company growth. The opportunity to work with a dedicated, talented, fun team that love their jobs, thrive on results and really enjoy coming to work each day (life is too short to simply go through the motions). We even have a company dog (who is hypoallergenic).

We’re looking for a rock star to join our team that can make a real difference in our company success. So, if you have the skills and meet the requirements in this posting and if you want to work somewhere that appreciates you and the work you do, is fast-moving, positive and results driven – we would love to have you join our team!!!!

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Job Summary
The Datacenter Automation Systems (DAS) team is committed to the successful implementation of autonomous and semi-autonomous vehicles throughout multiple datacenters. CBRE is seeking a full-time, permanent, CAD Operator with experience in MEP design, manufacturing or data center robotics-centric automation solutions. The DAS CAD Operator will report to the Client-approved location:
Moncks Corner, SC - full time / on site
The DAS CAD Operator requirements may vary according to Client-determined assignments, but most content relates to creating detailed designs for industrial automation equipment and systems in the DAS robotics portfolio at the Client's data centers. This position is part of a multi-disciplinary team creating engineering documentation and design drawing packages. The individual will collaborate with project engineers, technical writers, project managers, and other CAD/BIM Operators. Ideal candidates would be familiar with establishing and managing a design environment. Ideal candidates must be comfortable communicating regularly via video conference, email and internal ticketing systems.

Job Duties:
Acquire clear understanding of product requirements by reviewing, understanding, interpreting and revising technical specifications, blueprints and engineering illustrations, mockups, and prototypes.
Ability to read and interpret design standards and specifications, blueprints, drawings, redlines, etc
Coordinate the CAD design for Navigation Tape and GeoMarker installation package
Installation Drawings
Navigation DesignLayout
GeoMarker datum development
Material Takeoff
Working understanding of construction design package development for field installation.
Ability to translate existing field conditions from documentation and redlines to revise/edit design drawing packages.
Ability to learn software such as Lucidchart to generate shape files for navigation translated from design drawings. .
Capable of managing shifting design production to coordinate with field installation schedules.
Coordinate file management with 3rd party teams for document file transfer.
Maintain audits of latest design revisions against floor plan modifications.
Ability to perform repetitive field measurement tasks for long durations such as bending, kneeling, squatting ,walking, climbing stairs, etc.
Must have excellent organizational skills
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Other duties as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field. Minimum two or more years' construction administration, architecture, engineering or similar experience.

Preferred experience with some data center infrastructure projects. Experience in mission critical data centers is a strong plus. Preferred experience with robotic process automation.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

Working towards or eligible for licensure as either a Professional Engineer or Registered Architect is desired.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Overview:

Duties and Responsibilities:
Works with Business users and domain SMEs to understand requirements.
Assists in maintaining data models (dimensional models with conformed dimensions, entity relational models), and Data Vault models to satisfy analytics requirements.
Assist in building ETL processes to load and reconcile data in the warehouse.
Assists in data mapping activities by specifying logic and business rules for transforming and preparing data.
Provides assistance and support to the development and publication of reports and dashboards.
Assists with Data Quality (DQ) and Master Data Management (MDM) initiatives.
Assists in developing governance processes around data management and the warehouse development.

Performs other duties as assigned.

Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.

Familiarity with Visual Studio, TFS and SSIS. Familiarity with Master Data Management, data quality tools, data integration tools, R, and Python is desired. Financial Services experience and familiarity of big data concepts is a plus.

Office and Data Manager Job Description

Job Summary: Response is a non-profit in Aspen that works with survivors of domestic and sexual abuse. The office and data manager is responsible for managing the Response office and data collection and reporting as well as supporting the fundraising and outreach functions of the organization. (part time considered for the right applicant).

Responsibilities:

1. General Office:

Performs the full range of administrative duties for the office, including office management, maintaining office supplies and equipment. Answers incoming calls; assists visitors; handles mail.
Maintains agency files, ensures payment requests are submitted to the executive director, processes reports and renewals.
Works with vendors and other agencies to ensure the highest level of service.
Paying bills and processing payments.
Support other staff as needed.

2. Crisis Helpline:

Communicating with volunteer advocates with updates and scheduling to ensure that crisis helpline is adequately staffed.
Maintains volunteer and back up staff records and individual hours.
After completing the 30-hour volunteer advocate training, may be asked to work up to one week per month on the crisis line for evenings and a full weekend (additional compensation).

3. Fundraising and Outreach

Maintains Response website and social media outlets with accurate and timely postings.
Maintains donor database for fundraising and outreach efforts.
Provide logistical support for all Response events including volunteer management, soliciting donations, working with sponsors, marketing and more.
Works with executive director to create email and print newsletters on a regular basis.

4. Grant and Data Management

Coordination of Response’s annual grant calendar.
Assist executive director with grant reporting and tracking.
Coordination of program evaluation systems.
May include grant writing and proofing under the supervision of the executive director.
Maintains organizational databases and is responsible for overall records management.

Qualifications:

At least three years of work in an office setting.
Strong computer skills: Microsoft office, including Excel and Word and database experience.
A professional office manner and careful attention to detail.
The ability to maintain confidentiality and a calm manner when dealing with people in crisis.
A strong team player who is flexible with time and duties as they evolve.
Passionate about Response’s mission, culturally sensitive and trauma informed.
Background check and work verification required.
Ability to work 9 am -5 pm at the Aspen office (only applicants with housing in the Roaring Fork Valley will be considered)
Bilingual language skills (English and Spanish) preferred.

General Physical Requirements:

Hearing and vision corrected to normal ranges; able to work in high-stress situations; able to use the telephone and able to function in an office environment, including operation of office equipment.

Salary Range: $$27-$30/hour depending on experience. Benefits after 90 day trial period: 10 days of vacation per year, 11 paid holidays, 78 hours of wellness leave, health insurance, health spending account and retirement contribution.

To Apply: Send a short letter explaining why you would be a good fit for this position and your professional resume. WILL NOT CONSIDER WITHOUT BOTH

Position Details:

Summary of Duties:

This position is responsible for the development, implementation and management of systems used to collect research data for the Paul G. Allen School for Global Health (SGH) at Washington State University. This position interacts with a broad range of researchers to gather requirements for data collection and storage, and then designs, implements, and maintains these systems. Working as an intermediary between the School for Global Health and the College of Veterinary Medicine's Veterinary Information Systems unit, this position will also assist in the preparation of data sets for analysis and will act as the primary support contact for a REDCap instance supporting both domestic and international research programs, as well as other data collection systems. Infrequent international travel to assist international research programs may be necessary in this position.

To support WSU's ability to attract talent in a competitive job market, this recruitment has been approved for a hiring incentive/moving allowance payment of up to one month's salary.


Depending on your level of experience, you may begin as a IT Data Management-Entry or a IT Data Management- Journey.


To be considered for a IT Data Management-Entry, applicants must have:

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in a related technology field. Any combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the educational requirement on a year-for-year basis.

Experience with relational database systems and a working knowledge of structured query language (SQL).

Authorization to work in the US.

Experience with REDCap.

Strong understanding of database design.

Experience developing, maintaining, and managing IT applications and systems

Knowledge and experience with HTML, and CSS.

Knowledge and experience with Python, R, C# or other programming languages.

Experience with restful web services.

ETL processing design, planning, testing, and production implementations.

Data warehousing experience.

Experience with Tableau and\or Power BI.

We are currently seeking a Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst to join our team. We are looking for an energetic professional who enjoys working outdoors and values the freedom of working independently. If you enjoy a fast-paced environment and the challenges of a rewarding profession, consider a career in vegetation management with ECI.

Some of the most important characteristics of an ECI Resource Coordinator/Data Analyst is a desire to learn, an ability to adapt, and a commitment to engage in safe, constructive interactions with the public. You are accountable for advancing a culture of safety and excellence while providing quality and value to our customers and clients.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Industry competitive pay.
Company vehicle with fuel card to take to and from home & work.
Medical/Health/Dental/Vision/VOYA/Vacation Accrual/Paid Holidays/EAP eligibility on day one of employment (Full-Time Employees).
401K, life insurance, long-term disability eligibility first of the month after 3 months of service.
Sick Time eligibility on day 90 of employment.
Weekly pay checks and direct deposit.
Participation in Employee Referral Program (must meet eligibility requirements).
Boot and clothing program (company funded).
Ongoing training and assistance with obtaining industry certifications.




WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Provides first level support to internal and external customers for work management software suite and associated programs relating to work unit identification, data input, and invoice reconciliation for vegetation management activities relating to the utility transmission network.
Track defects within production processes and performs root cause analysis for functional issues to develop checklist for recurring problems.
Works to solve organizational problems by analyzing processes, workflows and planning activities to identify opportunities for automation or improvement.
Inputs, tracks, and monitors vegetation-related relay and sustained circuit outages into Work Studio and provides metrics to the Reliability and Performance Standards Team monthly.
Act as a liaison under the utility Information Technology group to work with management software providers to provide timely deliverables, requested upgrades, user licensing allocation, troubleshooting issues, and software implementation to ensure system functionality and continuity.
Maintains user rosters and updated permissions to ensure IT security and integrity of the utility networks.
Provides training assistance and planning guidance to work management software desktop, tablet, and thin client users in both office and field environments.
Maintains metrics, analyzes statistical data, and makes recommendations for budget corrections based on trend analysis.
All other duties and projects as assigned.




WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE:

5+ years experience administering a multi-user work management software program with an emphasis on bettering the end user experience.
Knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems), programming and cartography including analyzing spatial data through mapping software and other data sets.
Knowledge of database language such as SQL.
Proven work experience as a software Analyst or similar role.
Experience in maintaining a production related software for large number of users.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Customer interface skills and experience.
Strong computer skills and knowledge of QA databases and applications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Computer skills, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, GIS.




WHAT WOULD BE AMAZING TO HAVE:

Degree in computer science, geography, surveying, engineering, or related field.
GIS and Database entry skills preferred.
Knowledge of utility forestry, logging or agricultural maintenance a plus.
Being Bi-Lingual (Spanish) is a plus.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ECI FORESTER:

Working Environment

Work alone in an outdoor field environment; vehicle and foot patrol of utility power lines; remote locations as well as urban, city environment; physical demands and travel from site to site, including walking/hiking on various surfaces including flat, dry, wet, slippery, uneven, rough, steep terrain, hills, and slopes; exposure to noise, dust, grease, and all types of weather and temperature conditions; exposure to hazardous traffic conditions. Reasonable accommodations, if available, may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

Physical

The team member must have sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in a field environment; to walk up to 10 miles per day, stand, sit, and operate a motor vehicle for prolonged periods of time; to frequently stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, run, crawl, climb, reach, twist, grasp and make repetitive hand, arm and shoulder movement in the performance of daily duties (e.g., forcefully beat down brush); carry, push and/or pull light to heavy amounts of weight, frequently lift up to 10 lbs. and occasionally lift up to 60 lbs. (sandbags); to operate assigned equipment and vehicles; ability to verbally communicate to exchange information with public; ability to see and hear in normal range with or without correction; operate assigned field equipment, including handheld computer, range finder, fyrake, water backpack, shovel, and traffic cone.

Company Overview

Environmental Consultants (ECI) is a leading provider of vegetation and asset management consulting services to the utility industry. Successful professionals at ECI have come from a variety of backgrounds, including: forestry, arboriculture, natural resource management, biology, landscape maintenance, horticulture, nursery management, environmental sciences, geology, agriculture, parks & recreation management, urban forestry, geography, and more. For more information visit our website www.eci-consulting.com

Applicants must pass a pre-employment drug test and a criminal background check.

All candidates must possess a valid driver's license and have a good driving record.

ECI is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. EOE/AA : Minority/Female/ Vets/ Disabled.
