Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.




The following position is open in Chicago, IL., - Data Scientist - Supply Planning




What makes this a great opportunity?




As a world leader in premium spirits, Beam Suntory inspires human connections. Consumers from all corners of the globe call for the company's brands, including the iconic Jim Beam and Maker's Mark Bourbon brands, Suntory Whisky Kakubin and Courvoisier Cognac, as well as world renowned premium brands including Knob Creek, Basil Hayden's and Legent Bourbon; Yamazaki, Hakushu, Hibiki and Toki Japanese Whisky; Teacher's, Laphroaig and Bowmore Scotch Whisky; Canadian Club Whisky; Hornitos and Sauza Tequila; EFFEN, Haku and Pinnacle Vodka; and Sipsmith and Roku Gin.




Beam Suntory was created in 2014 by combining the world leader in bourbon and the pioneer in Japanese whisky to form a new company with a deep heritage, passion for quality, innovative spirit and vision of Growing for Good. Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, Beam Suntory is a subsidiary of Suntory Holdings Limited of Japan. Our culture is anchored deeply in a set of core values, including our East-Meets-West Culture, Yatte Minahare spirit, Giving Back to Society, Delighting Consumers, responsibly and Embracing Diversity & Inclusion.




Role Responsibilities




The Data Scientist – Supply Planning role combines a background in Sales & Operations Planning (Integrated Business Planning - IBP) with a deep understanding of data science. The Data Scientist will be self-motivated and exhibit excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to synthesize complex problems and create solutions. The ideal candidate will have more than just knowledge or skill set, as they also have a “can do" and “we over me” mindset to find solutions. This position will collaborate with the Supply Planning Analytics, S&OP CoE and Leadership, Regional S&OP teams, IT, and Commercial in the BUs across all three global regions to support the data and analytics needs for the implementation of the business transformation program.




CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Partner with Global S&OP functional areas (Supply Planning, Commercial, and Fulfillment) to optimize our processes as part of the Global Supply Planning team.
Implement process improvement initiatives that drive improvements to the metrics and streamline the Supply Chain
Utilize a diverse array of technologies and tools as needed, to deliver insights, optimize processes, and develop automation
Manage the analytics platform, build capabilities, support global user adoption of analytics and process adherence, develop and maintain technical documentation; work closely with IT for Data Engineering
Work closely with the technical community to drive an SAP IBP team of business users globally, allowing for internal problem-solving capabilities, a high degree of end-user acceptance
Partner with the business to understand the market segmentation strategies and develop visualization, models using machine learning (e.g. classification, clustering, regression) incorporating ABC-XYZ segmentation, and statistical analysis methods such as time-series analysis, statistical inference
Desgin and integrate a global Inventory Management to provide end-to end Supply Chain visibility to Deep dive large into demand/supply planning and supply chain data to explain change, develop insights, and provide business recommendations to improve attainment, adherence, inventory management , and other key metrics.
Perform exploratory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data, and identify patterns
Lead and mentor a team of data scientists, and analysts
Process structured, unstructured and semi-structured data and apply data cleaning



Qualifications & Experience

Advanced Degree or equivalent experience in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics
3-5+ years of experience with at least 2+ years in experience in a supply chain discipline with demonstrated End to End understanding of Supply Chain interdependencies for a CPG or Spirits company.
Excellent problem solving, analytical, written and verbal communication skills across many levels of the organization.
communications and presenting to senior leadership.
Experience with S&OP Planning tools like SAP IBP, SAP APO (DP and SNP) highly preferred
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, SAP HANA strongly preferred
Strong experience with Python/R, SQL, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with operations research, statistics, linear programming, constraint programming. 3+ years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying optimization, predictive and prescriptive, machine learning models
Ability to use collaborative programming tools like Git
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize competing requirements




At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Overview:

Do you have a passion for technology and are naturally curious? If you have strong interpersonal skills and are driven to learn and grow, then come join and add value at OneNeck IT Solutions as a Data Center Technician – Operations in Waukee, IA.


**Please note this position is considered an essential worker for our business and therefore will be required to work in the data center facility for all working hours.**


This is a full-time opportunity, working Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Responsibilities:

The Data Center Technician - Operations will operate, monitor, measure, and attain OneNeck IT Solutions’ Data Centers Service Level Commitments, and maintain facility appearance and integrity, especially during assigned shift. This role is responsible for providing assistance to customers and projects, as such situations arise. The data center is a critical aspect of the OneNeck business by ensuring availability, business continuity (no disruption), and security for internal and external customers. The data center must maintain high standards for assuring the integrity and functionality of its’ hosted computer environment and support services.

Monitor and Operate Data Centers critical functions and facilities to meet or exceed Service Levels. Monitor, correct, and report observed infractions of security policies and procedures. Detect and dispatch help for trouble situations within non-local facilities, and attempt remote troubleshooting if possible/practical
Measure and record vital statistics and produce appropriate reports, including shift and weekly reports. Record and maintain accurate incident and change records and logs.
Respond physically to trouble situations within the local facility and conduct troubleshooting (including of telecom circuits) as may be required.
Conduct routine walkthroughs of local facility, correcting both appearance and functional imperfections. Chaperone vendors and guests, as may become necessary.
Assist, as available, project activity including any of the following
Installation, termination, testing and labeling of all cross connects (cat5, coax, fiber) in the Data Center.
Moving and installation of cabinets and relay racks.
Hardware installation including: shelves, power strips, rails, cable management, and customer equipment.
Exhibit exemplary workmanship in such performance
Have a working knowledge of the responsibilities of the Data Center Technician – Security, and be able to assist with those responsibilities, as necessary.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications

Associates Degree -OR- 2+ years professional work experience.
3+ years technical support experience in a data center and/or HVAC environment and/or electrical field -OR- 1+ years of technical support in a OneNeck Data Center Facility (internal only)
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must live within 30 minutes of the data center.
Ability to work Wednesday from 11:00am to 7:00pm CT, Thursday-Friday from 9:00am-7:00pm CT and Saturday from 7:00am to 7:00pm CT.
Must be able to lift and carry equipment up to 75 pounds; climb equipment and walk on rooftops and cat-walks.

Other Qualifications

ITIL Certification or the willingness to pursue certification within 12 months of hire or work with management to pursue a reasonable alternative within 18 months.
Availability to occasionally work extra hours (including weekends) per an on-call basis.
Excellent communications with others, especially regarding technical matters.
Working knowledge of HVAC, Power, Fire, Security building systems operations and safety.
Working knowledge of telecommunications technologies, systems, and circuits.
Data center skills and experience in installing/moving equipment and cabling on a large-scale basis.
Experience working with various networking hardware such as multiplexers, routers, and switches.
Knowledge of common network protocols such as TCP/IP.
Experience with fault isolation and troubleshooting networks including LAN and WAN.
Familiarity with configuring networking equipment such as routers, switches, and hubs.
Experience with data communication issues, including security, resource management, capacity planning, monitoring, and performance.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities and interruptions.

#OneNeck IT Solutions offers multi-cloud solutions, combined with managed services, professional IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers across the country. OneNeck's team of technology professionals deliver secure, modern platforms and applications for organizations embracing data-driven transformation and secure end-to-end solutions.

The Accounting Business Analyst- Indirect Tax is responsible for multi-state and local sales and use tax, property tax, and other business tax administration and compliance, including research and analysis of related tax laws and communication with state and local jurisdictions and authorities, for multiple legal entities.

Core Responsibilities:
Accurate and timely payment and reporting of sales and use taxes
Accurate and timely payment of property taxes
Accurate and timely payment and reporting of other business taxes
Research and respond to organization inquiries regarding taxability issues and tax law changes
Respond to sales and use tax exemption certificate inquiries
Assist with tax audits
Complete tax account reconciliations
Assist with preparation of Federal and State corporate income tax packages for multiple legal entities
Assist with Unclaimed Property reporting and administration
Create SOPs and maintain process documentation

Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve processes, increase data integrity and provide quality customer service to business partners
Complete project work and special request assignments as needed or perform other duties as defined by manager
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.

Bachelor’s Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university in Accounting or related field and 2+ years’ experience with sales and use tax, property tax, other business taxes, and general accounting; or equivalent combination of education or experience, required.
Bachelor's Degree, preferred.
Thorough knowledge of financial and business principles, including GAAP.
Experience in manufacturing industry a plus.
Experience with RIA Checkpoint or other tax research software.
Solid math skills.
Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects, as well as strong follow through skills.
Detail oriented and strong organizational skills.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to complete projects timely and accurately.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.

About Smithfield Foods:
Headquartered in Smithfield, Va. since 1936, Smithfield Foods, Inc. is an American food company with agricultural roots and a global reach. With more than 60,000 jobs globally, we are dedicated to producing "Good food. Responsibly®" and serve as one of the world's leading vertically integrated protein companies. We have pioneered sustainability standards for more than two decades, including our industry-leading commitments to become carbon negative in our U.S. company-owned operations and reduce GHG emissions 30 percent across our entire U.S. value chain by 2030. We believe in the power of protein to end food insecurity and have donated hundreds of millions of food servings to our communities. Smithfield boasts a portfolio of high-quality iconic brands, such as Smithfield®, Eckrich® and Nathan's Famous®, among many others. For more information, visit www.smithfieldfoods.com, and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.

Helping People. Changing Lives.
CAPSLO Mission, Vision and Core Values

CAPSLO has a vaccination policy for employees. If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid religious or medical reason not to be vaccinated.

Position Summary:
Administers the data resources and systems of the Early Education and Child Care (EECC) programs within the Child, Youth and Family Services (CYFS) division. Ensures the availability, usability, integrity and security of program data. Manages systems development, resource integrations, hardware maintenance and acquisition, and project development. Oversees training and system support to users. Collaborates closely with Eligibility, Recruitment, Selection, Enrollment, and Attendance (ERSEA) teams for all CYFS programs. Liaisons with CAPSLO’s Information Technology department and provides support to agency-wide projects and initiatives. Supports CAPSLO'S mission by administering data resources and systems that contribute to effective program management, planning and oversight of services, and continuous quality improvement.

Required Education and Experience:
1. Must have a bachelor’s degree or 4 years experience in information technology, network administration, database management, or related field.
2. Two years of experience coordinating or managing data.
3. Two years of management, administrative, training, and/or monitoring experience.

Preferred Education and Experience:
1. Experience working in a social services, human services, or family services agency.
2. Familiarity with local, state, and federal agencies providing services to children.

Essential Functions:
Administration/Management

Administers multiple system platforms for the Early Education and Child Care programs. Guarantees effective functioning of enrollment, assessment, and data collection systems such as ChildPlus, NoHo, Learning Genie, DRDP, ASQ Online, and Client Track.
Ensures systems are accessible to end users, including clients accessing service portals. Oversees on-going support and technical assistance on the functionality and use of data systems. Ensures an optimal user experience.
Supervises the Data Resources Coordinator and oversees the position’s assigned data systems such as ChildPlus. Ensures there are coordinated ERSEA data system practices and initiatives. Incorporates input from and consultation with the Data Resources Coordinator, ERSEA Supervisor, Information Technology department, administrative staff, clients, and vendors.
Ensures internal and external data and data systems support the completion of the Office of Head Start Program Information Reports (PIR).

Fiscal/Budget

Works with the CYFS Division Director and Program Directors on program budgets to ensure fiscal support for data systems, staffing, and analysis.
Procures hardware, software, user licenses, and system-related supplies. Works closely with finance staff and generates purchase requisitions, supply requisitions, requests for proposals, competitive quotes, etc.

Monitoring

Monitors input and output of data to ensure both accurate and meaningful reporting to staff, governing bodies, and funders. Maintains quality control protocols and provides regular reports to CYFS Division Director.
Ensures systems are compliant with internal and external security protocols. Maintains data confidentiality per best practice, contract requirements, funders’ performance standards, and local, state, and federal regulations.

Planning

Identifies improvement opportunities to data systems that enhance effectiveness, integrity, and user experience. Formulates solutions and enhancements and conducts related research on topics such as data migration, integration with current systems, and cost versus benefit. Advises management staff and executes solutions.
In conjunction with the Data Resources Coordinator, ERSEA Supervisor, Area Managers, and Program Director, supports the quarterly review of key data as part of self-assessment, planning, and the Self-Assessment for Continuous Improvement and Evaluation.
Oversees the development and implementation of training and technical assistance to ensure that monitoring, record-keeping, and reporting systems are fully understood.
Partners with the Planning Department as needed to provide data that supports assessments, reports, and funding applications.

Communication

Advises and collaborates with a range of staff to enhance and develop remote learning systems for both employees and clients. Oversees user support and training on virtual communication and educational technology resources such as Zoom, KMI education modules, and Google Meet and Sites.

Community Relationships and Partnerships

Networks within and/or outside the agency to increase knowledge of resources and services that benefit clients; develop effective relationships; further agency and community goals; and/or raise the profile of CAPSLO and its programs.

Other Duties

Attends staff meetings and trainings.
Maintains working knowledge of agency programs, organizational structure, and policies and procedures.
Must be dedicated to the goals and philosophy of the division’s child development programs and CAPSLO.
Must use reasonable precautions in the performance of one’s duties and adhere to all applicable safety rules and practices; and act in such a manner as to assure at all times maximum safety to one’s self, fellow employees, clients and children.
Must understand, uphold and continue working toward accomplishing the mission, strategic goals, and performance measures of the agency and ensure all direct reports understand their role in accomplishing the above.
Performs other duties as needed.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge
1. Working knowledge of agency programs, organizational structure, and policies and procedures.
2. Familiarity with local, state, and federal agencies providing services to children.
Skills
1. Must have strong computer skills, with knowledge of MS Office, Word, Excel, Publisher, Google Workspace, data management software, and web-based applications.
2. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
3. Must be self-motivated with a strong sense of time management and organizational skills.
4. Must demonstrate sound judgment in decision-making.
Abilities
1. Must be able to relate well to all people of the community regardless of color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or socio-economic level.
2. Must possess the ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.

Supervisory Responsibility:
1. Supervises Data Analysts and the Data Resources Coordinator.

Work Environment:
1. Requires working indoors in a temperature-controlled environment with some exposure to copier and printer chemicals/fumes.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Physical
1. Position requires intermittent sitting, standing, walking, twisting and bending.
2. Must be able to lift 30 pounds waist high.
3. Simple grasping and hand manipulation required, as well as reaching above and below the shoulder level.

Travel:
Must be available to travel throughout the year in and out of the state (up to 25%/year).

License & Certifications:
Must have dependable, insured transportation and valid California Driver License (mileage to be reimbursed) and acceptable driving record. A DMV printout and proof of insurance will be required.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications:
1. Must be at least 18 years of age by date of hire.
2. Must submit proof of current vaccination status for measles, pertussis, and influenza (or a current, signed influenza declination form) in compliance with SB 792.
3. Must comply with the CAPSLO COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, either being fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption.
4. Must complete a health screening physical completed within 30 days prior to employment and a current TB skin test/Chest X-Ray.
5. Employment is contingent upon meeting all job requirements and background requirements: criminal history check (Inclusive of DOJ, FBI and Child Abuse), acknowledgement of child abuse reporting responsibility, criminal record statement (Form LIC508), etc. A criminal history clearance is required prior to employment.
6. Upon hire agency staff will check the Megan’s Law (or the current sexual predator website) to ensure each staff being hired is clear for employment. Program administrative staff will check the website annually to ensure all program staff are cleared to work.
7. Must meet the Head Start Program Performance Standards and State requirements.
8. Employment in Head Start, Early Head Start and Migrant and Seasonal Head Start Programs is contingent upon approval of the Policy Council.

Other Duties:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Reasonable Accommodations:
I have read and understand the Essential Functions of this position, including the Responsibilities and Duties. I also acknowledge that the Responsibilities and Duties for this position may change in the future with or without prior notice.
I further understand that I can request a reasonable accommodation, should one be necessary for me to carry out the Essential Functions of this position. I can perform these with or without reasonable accommodation.

Compensation and Benefits Package

Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Plan
CAPSLO offers benefits through a group medical, dental, vision, flexible spending account, life and AD&D insurance program. CAPSLO pays the full amount (100%) of the premiums to cover full-time employees, and half (50%) of the premiums to cover eligible part-time employees. Eligible employees may elect, at their own cost, to have medical, dental and vision insurance coverage for their dependents. Additionally, CAPSLO offers a Long Term Disability ("LTD") insurance program for eligible employees.

Retirement Savings Plan
CAPSLO offers eligible employees the opportunity to contribute a portion of their earnings to a Section 403(b) Retirement Plan. Employees are 100% vested upon enrollment into the plan. CAPSLO matches 60% of every dollar contributed up to an annual maximum of 15% of your annual salary (not to exceed IRS limits) after 6 months of employment.

Holidays
Twelve paid holidays during the course of the each calendar year. Employees also receive one extra workday off with pay as a "Personal Holiday."

Vacation/Sick Leave
CAPSLO awards 80-160 hours of vacation annually with a maximum accrual of 320 hours, depending on years of service. Paid Sick time is accrued at 8 hours per month (based on weekly hours) with a maximum accrual of 280 hours. CAPSLO also offers the opportunity to convert unused sick time to vacation and a vacation cash out for eligible employees once a year.

Additional Benefits
CAPSLO offers additional benefits including employee assistance program (EAP), reduced rates for pet insurance, reduced rates for cellular phone service, reduced rates for car rentals, and additional time off for positions classified as exempt, and workers’ compensation insurance.

For questions regarding the application process or open positions, contact the Recruiting Department at 805-544-4355 or email recruitment@capslo.org.

Education: Bachelor degree in mathematics, operations research, applied statistics, economics, data science or a related quantitative discipline.

Experience: 3 years experience applying quantitative, business analytics, and computational skills.

1) Competence with analytic software packages such as SAS, R, SPSS
2) Knowledge of database concepts and practices
3) Ability to work in a collaborative, team oriented environment
4) Ability to apply strong analytical and complex problem solving and critical thinking skills
5) Excellent oral and written communication skills.
6) Willingness for occasional travel

1) Master's degree in mathematics, operations research, applied statistics, data mining, data science or a related quantitative discipline
2) Experience with large data environments, such as Hadoop Experience with reporting tools such as Cognos or Tableau.

Description:

Job Summary: This position is responsible for working on data analysis projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results, and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. This includes data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation, reconciliation, and visualization.

Project 1
Assist with data cleaning and mapping substation assets (T-Lines, Battery, CB’s, UG Cables) into AHC Monitoring Software to improve the overall number of assets being scored, working our way to 100% of assets being scored inside the software. Create and implement an classification based algorithm that will help identify assets that can be mapped into APM software using their SN and manufacturing specs to increase the speed at which assets and their inputs are being brought into the software

Project 2
Creation of new predictive analytics dashboard to be leveraged by planning and renewal teams for Condition Based Maintenance activities.

Project 3
Design a new Power Quality (PQ) meter uptime status dashboard for TSAM to leverage to understand and measure the overall performance of the individual meters and data availability.

Project 4
FOW AHC and Station PI mapping to IPS project
Design and lead the concept of AHC / Station PI points to be mapped to IPS in order to help the FOW team get the data need for Condition Based Inspection activities

This position must have a working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as Power BI, SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, Tableau, SAS, SPSS, and others to perform analysis and interpret data.

This is a HYBRID position and onsite days are scheduled in the New Albany, Ohio Office on Tuesday’s but is always subject to change. Team may also come in other days for team building / vendor onsite work / project work.

Tasks: Utilize inquiry skills to obtain a clear understanding of business processes and needs. Essential function: Provide meaningful, concise reporting of analytic results.
Tasks: Develop concise meaningful written reports and provide oral presentation of information. Develop reporting dashboards that meet business needs for status, trends, and variances Collaborate with IT and business units to operationalize meaningful reports and dashboards.

Portsmouth Regional Hospital is a 234-bed acute care hospital located in Portsmouth, NH. We serve the Seacoast region's residents in New Hampshire, Maine and Massachusetts. The hospital is one of the area's largest employers. We are the only ACS Verified Level II Trauma Center on New Hampshire's Seacoast. Portsmouth Regional Hospital is the Seacoast's only comprehensive heart and vascular program. Also, the only Comprehensive Stroke Center on the Seacoast. We provide 7 comprehensive neurosurgical and stroke clot retrieval and aneurysm coiling programs for both ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes. Portsmouth Regional Hospital, is a member of HCA Healthcare's Capital Division, one of the nation's leading providers of health care services.

HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS NOT A REMOTE WORK POSITION.

JOB SUMMARY

The Data Analyst will support the design, development, enhancement and utilization of advanced data analytics and business intelligence information, and support process improvement to enable the District to build and sustain a 'best in industry' data-driven decision-making environment, supporting a culture of continuous learning and continuous process improvement.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Job Functions

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function of the job satisfactorily.

% TIME

•

Data Analytics - Support the design, development and use of advanced data analytics and tools to meet customer and business needs. Analyze data, formulate and communicate insights. Perform basic analysis of large and diverse datasets, such as advanced metering data, hydro operational data, etc. Programmatically evaluate noisy data and develop automated analytics processes. Explore data sources, processes, uses and definition. Clean, process and translate data into model designs that are tested, refined, moved to production and maintained.

40%

•

Business Intelligence - Support the design, development and use of new and existing business intelligence processes and reporting tools. Conduct quality assurance checks. Create recurring reports. Develop reporting dashboards. Perform ad-hoc requests as assigned, etc. Provide direct support of business intelligence tools, data environment, performance reporting metrics, and financial data cubes. Test, monitor, validate and publish business intelligence content.

25%

•

Reporting, Communications & Collaboration - Perform basic ad-hoc requests, including data analytics, reporting needs, and process improvements and automations. Provide data analytics insights and expertise and actively participate on Data Analytics and Business Intelligence core team. Collaboratively work and communicate with members of cross-functional teams and internal stakeholders.

20%

•

Project Teams - Participates on project teams performing individual assignments. Coordinates and facilitates project team meetings. May lead data analytics, business intelligence initiative, or research efforts of a limited nature.

15%

Additional Responsibilities

•

Maintain regular and predictable attendance: Perform related duties and responsibilities as required. Comply with District policies. Complete all required training. Maintain a working knowledge and comply with District safety procedures and specific safety requirements of this position, and those in accordance with applicable provisions of the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) and Washington Administrative Code (WAC). Employees with access to confidential employee records and information are required to restrict access from any unauthorized person, except on a need to know basis.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This is the entry-level role in data analytics and business intelligence. College graduates with demonstrated skills in designing, developing, and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards

Data Analyst II

5+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated examples of designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, complex data analytics, corporate performance reporting, and dashboards is required.

- Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations is desired.

Data Analyst Senior

7+ years progressively responsible experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role with demonstrated in-depth experience designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to support user needs, including complex data analytics in a variety of subjects, corporate performance reporting, and development of dashboards required

Experience related to the area of the organization this role will support, such as asset management or hydro operations preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

•

Working knowledge of data analytics around large production data and operational datasets using a variety of techniques using mathematics and statistics.

•

Working knowledge of quantitative analysis and programming techniques.

•

Working knowledge of analytics, data mining, and data cleansing.

•

Knowledge of data warehousing/business intelligence best practices, methodologies, standards, and data architectures.

•

Knowledge of operating systems, relational database design, logical data modeling, data warehousing, and relational database management systems.

•

Familiarity with management decision making subjects and concepts, such as finance and accounting.

•

Familiarity with process improvement techniques such as six sigma or similar.

•

Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills to solve problems creatively.

•

Good communication skills that can effectively communicate complex subjects to a variety of audiences.

•

Strong customer service skills and orientation.

•

Detail oriented with a high level of intellectual curiosity.

•

Strong logic and reasoning skills.

•

Strong critical thinking skills.

•

Able to analyze data and issues in a disciplined, structured and analytical manner, and leverage various tools and techniques such as mathematics, statistics and data science to create solutions.

•

Able to formulate a solution to a business problem, translate it into requirements or quantitative terms using analytical tools, analyze the results, iteratively refine the solution and effectively communicate results.

•

Ability to translate user requests into functional and technical requirements and effectively communicate with both the end user and technical team.

•

Ability to utilize information in both quantitative and qualitative form to inform development of actions.

•

Able to identify and weigh strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions.

•

Ability to work constructively and maintain a positive outlook when facing tight deadlines.

•

Ability to plan, organize and prioritize work in order to optimize progress on multiple assignments and successfully meet deadlines.

•

Ability to work collaboratively on a team.

•

Ability and desire to solve problems and develop solutions.

•

Ability to accept constructive feedback.

•

Must enjoy the challenge and nuances of applying technology solutions to complex and often imperfect datasets.

•

Must be proficient in reading, writing and speaking English.

Company Description

ColoHouse is a worldwide retail colocation, cloud, and managed services provider with 26 locations in 21 cities in North America, Europe, and Asia. Our full suite of colocation, cloud and managed services gives our customers the flexibility to customize their IT infrastructure needs to meet their business objectives. We focus on delivering quality infrastructure, services, and support, giving our customers the ability to allocate more resources toward their core business.

Job Summary

This individual will be responsible for the day-to-day activities that support data center operations, support of IT systems, network services, business-critical process and procedures that support the delivery of customer products and services. The ideal candidate is a strongly motivated, self-starter who conducts themselves professionally and works under minimal supervision. Shifts available Mondy-Friday 9am-6pm, or 12pm-9pm. On call every other weekend.

The ideal candidate will possess:

Experience from racking and stacking of servers to battery/power and structured cabling.

Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects while meeting deadlines and ensuring uptime

Ability to lead projects and can work autonomously under the customer direction, written or verbal, on servers/routers/switches.

Responsibilities and Duties:

· Supports delivery of data center services including colocation, telecommunications services, and deployment of additional services to customers and internal business systems.

· Maintain cleanliness, appearance, and organization of the Data Center.

· Acts as a technical and operational contact for data center customers, vendors, and carriers as it relates to colocation, connectivity, and network products and services. Classification: Internal Use

· Properly and efficiently install cabinets, networking equipment, PDU’s and servers as required.

· Installation of fiber optic and ethernet cabling

· Responsible for inbound/outbound shipments

· Carries out remote hands tasks under the direction of the Data Center Manager, Network/Engineering, and IT Manager necessary to support internal networks, IT infrastructure, computers, electronics, and telephone systems.

· Conducts activities inside IT and telecommunications rooms or cabinets such as the installation of IT and network hardware, making or running patch cables, and verifying or testing cable paths.

· Coordinates and oversees access to and work within the facility with third-party contractors, vendors, and carriers related to structured cabling installation, circuit delivery and equipment installations in IT and telecommunications rooms and customer space.

· Supports Meet Me Room/Carrier points of presence and aids in operations, administration, and maintenance of infrastructure, network equipment, and tasks related to the delivery and support of network services.

Qualifications & Required Skills:

· 3-5 years of experience working in data center environments or similar constructs. Proven experience in managing structured cable plants and working with carrier services and products (Ethernet, DWDM, CWDM, MPLS, fiber, T1, POTS, etc.)

· Fluent knowledge of structured cabling, testing, and labeling.

· Experience operating production and mission-critical networks and systems.

· Presents and conducts self in a professional manner; promotes a positive company image.

· Critical thinking, problem-solving and analytical skills.

· Ability to lift material, IT servers and equipment in execution of the responsibilities and scope of work described

· Creates and manages database reports, visualizations, and dashboards. Creates automation for repeating database tasks.

· Experience building centralized data warehouse.

Job Description

Position Title: Development Data Manager
Reports to: Director of Philanthropy
Position Status: Full-Time, Requires Flexible Hours, Hybrid schedule with in-person and virtual. This position requires a quiet workspace for privacy while on remote.

Position Summary:
The Development Data Manager will work closely with the fundraising team, finance team, and executive director to support the fundraising goals of United Way’s dynamic organization. The Development Data Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining donor contact records, campaigns, funds, appeals and solicitations. The position will be responsible for managing department’s mailings, submitting corporate grants, and support of events and volunteer projects.

Development Responsibilities:

Serves as administrative support to the fundraising team and executive director, including scheduling meetings, creating, and managing calendar invites, preparing supporting materials, and sending reminders.
Completes and tracks corporate grant applications in collaboration with fundraising and community impact teams.
Problem solves special situations with finance team.
Coordinates and prepares mail merges, appeals, acknowledgments, awards, thank yous, and other resource development correspondence.
Supports and participates in organizational activities and/or special events.

Duties may include assisting with the planning and execution of the project and working registration table always ensuring volunteers have a meaningful experience.

Responsible for management of campaign material inventory and supplies to ensure adequate supplies are available to support workplace giving campaigns.
Participates in training, webinars, and seminars to keep abreast of industry and system’s best practices and enhancements.
Lead coordination and communications with other Global fundraising accounts and regional United Way’s when there is a company with locations in other

United Way service areas,

Responsible for preparing, coordinating, and delivering campaign materials to companies.
Send correspondence, manage RSVPs and prepare materials for annual

Employee Campaign Coordinator trainings.

Complete yearly DBII report to United Way Worldwide by deadline.
Pull donor information and provide ongoing campaign status as requested.
Assist with the prospecting, research and outreach for current and new partners.
Take meeting minutes for Resource Development committee and provide to

Committee Chair and Director in a timely manner.

Assist with Resource Development Strategic Plan efforts and follow through on its completion.

Responsibilities within Customer Relationship Management System (CRM):

Primary responsibility for creating and updating campaign giving pages.
Provide regular data entry to ensure accurate reporting of all fundraising efforts including maintaining accurate corporate and individual donor records in CRM database.
Maintains quality of data including accurate company and individual donor records in CRM database.
Processes all fundraising and campaign transactions such as, match requests and workplace contributions.
Carry out creation of envelopes for miscellaneous, individual, corporate and employee pledge posting.
Compiles necessary data and backup documentation for invoices and reports.
Assists with campaign data management and provides reports as needed; to include but not limited to campaign performance, communication, donor information, compilation of recognition names for leadership giving roster and statistical analysis.
Provides research and reconciliation for third-party processed accounts to ensure accuracy of reporting.

Qualifications - Education and Experience:

Associates degree or 2 years’ experience in similar role.
1 year experience using Salesforce a must.
A background in finance is helpful.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong organization and time management skills with ability to multi-task.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Proficiency in Salesforce, Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Power

Point is a must.

Must have the ability to perform mail merges and learn new applications quickly.
Excellence grammar, spelling, and proofreading skills.
Understanding of and commitment to the mission, vision, and goals of United

Way.

Additional Requirements:

Position requires local travel. Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required. Vehicle insurance and up to date registration is required. Travel mileage is reimbursable at the approved IRS rate.
Ability to lift 30 pounds.

The Arc Central Chesapeake Region supports people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD) to live, work, and connect with their communities.

Technology is a key pillar of The Arc’s day-to-day operations. We rely on the systems and programs in place to track, support, and store important information across the organization.

As the Data & Reporting Manager, you are responsible for the management, use, and integration of organizational technology and platforms. The Data & Reporting Manager will facilitate data generation and reports, will implement protocols and processes to extract data efficiently and correctly, and support relevant team members. The Data & Reporting Manager will work with department heads to understand the needs of each department and track/analyze results using a variety of dashboards and reports. The Data & Reporting Manager will specifically support the Director of Innovation & Improvement in the management of The Arc’s data reporting needs around Results-Based Accountability measures.

The ideal candidate will have experience maintaining and managing large data sets and understand best practices around preparing, summarizing, distributing, and identifying trends and correlations in reports. The candidate must be someone who can guarantee that data is accessible, usable, and stored according to HIPAA and PHI requirements.

This role requires a bachelor’s degree in information technology or a related field along with three years of data management, analytic reporting, and data visualization experience. Experience using Power BI is strongly preferred. The annual salary is $67,500 and comes with a competitive benefits package, ongoing professional development, and education assistance.

About The Arc Central Chesapeake Region
The Arc Central Chesapeake Region (The Arc) is a dynamic regional organization providing person-centered supports for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live, work, and connect with their communities. We advocate for equity and access for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live self-determined lives and foster opportunities towards self-sufficiency. To learn more, visit www.thearcccr.org.

The Arc highly encourages all employees to become fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and other communicable diseases. All new hires who have a COVID-19 vaccination card are encouraged to submit a copy to our People & Culture department.

Job Type: Full time; In-office Henderson, Nevada

Pay: $55,000 / year

Schedule: Full time

Job Description:

We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Entry Specialist to join our Venue Research team in Henderson, Nevada.

Who We Are

In 2007, two pretty sharp brothers decided to bootstrap a new business venture using their poker winnings to fund it. A week before inception, one brother got a fox red Labrador retriever puppy and named him Red. He quickly became the center of their universe and the name Red Dog Media was officially born.

Today, Red Dog Media focuses on internet marketing; specifically performance marketing, search engine marketing, landing page optimization, and conversion rate optimization. What started with four employees has grown to over 40 people over the past 15 years.

Culture + Core Values

Our core values are woven throughout our entire interview process in order to gauge whether a candidate is a good cultural fit. There are several initiatives that keep the core values at the forefront of our culture. A few examples are: being discussed in 6 month reviews; our employee appreciation program; and being an integrated part of our company’s operating system.

Our Core Values:

Be Curious - Having a high level of engagement; Digging into problems; Not being satisfied with good enough; Being open to new ideas; Not being a know-it-all.

Be a Problem Solver - This is what separates the doers from the dreamers. It’s about executing and getting the important stuff done. A problem solver prioritizes, organizes, and simplifies. They are detail-oriented to make sure it's done right.

Be a Championship Teammate - While a "team player" is collegial, a champion teammate is much more. They have the drive to succeed, work hard, come prepared, hold themselves accountable to high standards, elevate those around them, and are coachable.

Be Better Than Yesterday - Do you bring more skills to the table today than a year ago? How do you plan to be better a year from now? We work in a fast-paced competitive industry. If we stagnate, we’ll get left behind. This applies at the company and personal level. Growth and improvement need not be only in technical skill sets; personal growth can be even more valuable. We embrace positive change and stretch ourselves to grow both personally and professionally.

Research, analyze, and input industry-specific data from internet-based sources

Data analysis

Organized

Strong work ethic with an “above and beyond” attitude
Strong self-learning abilities

Paragon Services Engineering is looking for one highly motivated and experienced Engineer for a Mission Critical Data Center. This positions is expected to effectively operate and maintain the day to day engineering requirements of a Mission Critical Data Center to ensure zero downtime; while performing engineering, electrical, HVAC, and plumbing, repairs, and maintenance duties in support of the facility under the direction of the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager.

We are committed to providing our customers with an exemplary service to operate and maintain their properties in a Class “A” condition. The Engineer position was established to provide these services at complex properties that require full time multiple engineering staff.

To accomplish this mission, the Engineer’s duties are to operate, monitor, and maintain the design criteria of the buildings operating systems and grounds. The Engineer shall report to the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager, and they shall provide the following for their assigned projects:

Principal Job Duties:

Strong technical expertise and mechanical/electrical system knowledge is required for this position along with superior administrative, supervisory, and communication skills. · Assists the Chief Engineer preparing the building operations budget.

· Coordinate vendors and T.I. construction and various projects.

· Oversight of any other company personnel and vendors working at the building.

HVAC Maintenance and Operations, Central plant operations, Cooling tower maintenance, Water treatment systems, Air handlers operations and maintenance, Boiler systems, Air balancing, Dust Collector / Air Scrubber Operations, Compressed Air Systems Operation and Maintenance Plumbing, Domestic water supply repairs and troubleshooting, Storm systems repairs and troubleshooting, Sewer system analysis and repair, Irrigation system repairs and operation, Backflow device repairs, Electrical Supply and Distribution Systems, Re-lamping, Lighting system retrofits, Emergency power supply system maintenance and troubleshooting, System repairs, Relocation of electrical power supply devices, Outdoor water fixture operation and maintenance. Curb painting and traffic control device installations and maintenance, Roof drain repairs and maintenance, General Building Maintenance, Property inspections and reporting, Inventory control of perishable building goods and repair components, Access hardware repairs and maintenance (doors, gates, etc.…), Ceiling tile replacement, Cosmetic wall repairs and painting, Office furniture assembly and installations, Office relocations, FLS Systems Operation and Maintenance.

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY

Summary / Objective:

This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.

The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.

Essential Functions:

· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.

· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.

Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.

Competencies:

Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.
Ability to translate business needs into high-level technical specifications and design.
Working knowledge of EDI configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.
Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP.
Knowledge of state, federal and local regulations concerning use, disclosure and confidentiality of all patient records including a strong knowledge of the HIPAA Privacy and Security Act.

Required Education and/or Work Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.
5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI systems, preferably in a healthcare environment.
6 + years of experience in the development and/or support of software systems are required.
3+ years related experience including developing requirements, designing and executing test cases in IT
Hands-on X12 health care insurance transaction (834, 837, 270, 271, 999 etc.) data mapping and issue resolution experience
Experience with SQL, relational databases and Microsoft development tools, such as VB, VB Script, .NET or ASP.
Experience with QA methodology and problem-solving techniques/tools.
Experience with multi-tiered client-server and web-based applications.
Experience with working with developers and internal technical teams to develop and test EDI processes.

Preferred Education and/or Work Experience:

Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid.
Experience creating EDI processes “from the ground up” in a small to mid-sized organization.
Experience with applying Agile Methods.
Experience with healthcare claims and billing file types.
Experience with Citra EZ-CAP or similar systems.
Understanding of health industry diagnosis, procedure and revenue codes and their application.
Experience writing complex SQL scripts.
Understanding of EDI 834 enrollment transactions, including Adds, Changes, Terminations, Cancellations, and error processing.

The Director of Data & Evaluation leads First 5’s Data and Evaluation strategy which supports shared accountability, continued organizational learning, public awareness, and policy advocacy as part of our role in evolving the early childhood system.


We believe data, research, and evaluation are tools for making policy change, and creating a shared system and stakeholder understanding of community priorities and needs. We focus on generating and sharing data, research, and results to inform internal agency decision making and our work with partners, public policy, planning, and advocacy. Through participatory research, storytelling, and other practices consistent with data decolonization and democratization, we put the power of data back into the hands of the people. We use data to highlight community conditions, the strengths and needs of our county’s youngest children, their families, and the providers who serve them, and to advance policies that promote equity. We partner with colleagues and community stakeholders on data and evaluation efforts to identify promising practices, demonstrate effectiveness, support efforts to scale and sustain effective strategies, and promote continuous quality improvement in the early childhood system.


This position leads all the First 5’s efforts related to data, results-based accountability, reporting for legislative mandates, evaluation, and research. The Director plays a leadership role and collaborates closely with Communications, Policy, and Program colleagues to use data to tell the story about First 5’s impact. Responsibilities include coordinating the activities of the team with those of other departments and outside agencies and managing and overseeing the complex and varied functions of the team.


Provide strategic Agency leadership to connect data, research and evaluation with continuous program improvement, revenue generation, communications, government affairs, and public policy.
Play a leadership role in Agency growth and change management, including demonstrating bi-directional communication and effective management practices to support clarity, alignment, effective structures and culture, and progress towards goals.
Lead the Data and Evaluation team. Attract, retain, train, supervise, coach, and be committed to the professional development of staff. Hold self and others accountable for high quality work and achievement of goals.
Provide oversight for data and evaluation efforts related to First 5’s role in administering public funding, including local ballot initiatives for early care and education, and contracts with managed care.
Oversee administration of Results Based Accountability for tracking, monitoring, and reporting for continuous learning and improvement.
Lead research and evaluation practices, including the work of contracted evaluators, using equity-informed, community-centered, and research-to-action approaches, to shape and complement the agency policy agenda, communication, programs, and investments.
Partner with Technology and Program staff to evolve and develop technology infrastructure to support strategic and streamlined data collection, reporting, analysis and promising practice implementation.
Plays a key leadership role in First 5’s strategic planning process, ensuring that planning is tied to data, research and evaluation, and program outcomes.
Lead the identification of and negotiation of data sharing MOUs, implement confidentiality and privacy procedures.
Oversees Data and Evaluation budget, including the procurement of contracted work, for appropriate budget items.
Additional projects and duties as assigned.

*
Qualifications*
Any combination of training and experience that would provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the required qualifications would be:


A minimum of ten years of full-time progressively responsible relevant leadership experience in Public, Non-Profit or Corporate setting.
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in Public Policy, Data, Evaluation, or related field may be substituted for 4 years of experience. A Master’s degree may be substituted for an additional year of experience.

*
Knowledge of:*


Principles and practices of executive leadership and staff supervision.
Principles and practices of management, supervision, training and team leadership
Principles and practices of effective, clear and accessible presentation of data to broad audiences, internal and external.
Principles and practices of data analysis, including data visualization and dashboards.
Principles and practices of Results Based Accountability (RBA).
Strategies and practices for using data, research, and evaluation to advance equity and policy advocacy, including participatory and community centered approaches to collection, analysis, and dissemination.
Evaluation methodologies, analytical and data collection techniques including quantitative and qualitative methods, and formative evaluation techniques with a “research-to-action” approach.
Public policies and programs related to early childhood and maternal and child health, education, public health, community development, or related field
Strategic planning practices and techniques for stakeholder engagement
Principles and practices of business and public administration.
Principles and practices of direct client service delivery.
Budgetary and contract administration practices.
Office administrative practices and procedure, including records management and the operation of standard office equipment.
Computer applications and software related to work including database development and modification, and report generation techniques.
Cross-cultural sensitivity
Program planning, project management, process design, and facilitation.
Principles and practices of management and supervision, including work planning, resource allocation, and training.
Principles and practices of contract negotiation, development, and management
Budgetary and contract administration practices
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Office 365 preferred

*
Ability to:*


Serve effectively as a member of the Executive Leadership Team
Provide leadership and effectively organize, coordinate, and supervise professional and administrative staff
Communicate effectively orally and in writing to staff and the Commission
Promote teamwork and integration within and across the agency
Demonstrate cultural awareness and sensitivity in a variety of contexts
Read, analyze, and interpret common professional publications, legislative or policy documents, financial reports and related agency documents and information
Plan and project manage work to ensure organizational goals are achieved
Develop a wide variety of short- and long-range plans
Analyze, develop, and monitor budgets
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff throughout the Agency
Facilitate groups and manage meetings effectively
Adapt, with minimal or no advance notice, to changes in agency operations and work assignments or procedures
Define and creatively address problems or management challenges requiring analysis of multiple variables or situations, collect and analyze information, consider alternatives, and draw valid conclusions

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Government Grant Data Analyst/Database Administrator, works under the general supervision of the Director of Grants. This role is responsible for creation of reports, dashboards, and other visualizations on data associated with grant awards and projects and business processes to provide insights in support of decision-making efforts. The Grant Data Analyst works as a liaison with departments and Elected Officials to coordinate data capture of all direct and subrecipient data and required reporting. The Analyst also coordinates the capture, transfer, sharing, integration and implementation of data systems, add-ons, plug-ins and bridges. This role is responsible for coordination of database and repository centralizing all federal awards.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBLITIES

Analyzing data using statistical techniques and providing reports. Developing and implementing databases and data collection systems. Acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and maintain data systems Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and cleaning data Maintain record of all grant operating department business processes and controls Suggest and implement approved tracking mechanisms to assist in convergence of data from current spreadsheets to database and upcoming ERP system. Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities Evaluates financial reports and performance reports makes escalate concerns to management regarding trends and potential negative impacts. Assist in the evaluation of the effectiveness of grants, compliance with federal regulations, federal agencies, and specific grant contract provisions. Monitors funded projects to prevent over-expenditure of funds; audit disallowance and ensure awards are fully expended. Evaluates grant expenditure agreements to differentiate between sub-recipients or contractors. Analyzes internal and external financial reports, including single audits. Assist in the set-up of electronic database and repository. Maintains electronic database and repository for efficient data collection and report production. Monitors and report the spending of awards, budget adjustments, contract amendments, grant match and cost allocation plans. Assists in the reduction and elimination of findings and questions regarding costs. Performs special project analysis as requested. Reconciles reported revenues and expenditures to the general ledger for grant and prepares the necessary journal entries for correction and posting. Communicates reminders to departments receiving monies of report submission deadlines and when the grant period will expire and/or when an extension maybe needed. Coordinate with external auditors for financial or audit support requests. Other duties as assigned by the Division Director of Grants and Contracts.

JOB SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and governmental accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.
Administration and Management Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Mathematics Knowledge of arithmetic and their applications. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc), Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Customer and Personal Service Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
English Language Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.
Grant Lifecycle Knowledge of the linear lifecycle that includes discovering, creating and programing the funding opportunity, applying, making award decisions, and successfully implementing the award.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, or related field and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
(5-6) years of professional accounting experience, governmental preferred, with a minimum of (4) years of grant administration, data analytics and auditing of state funded grant programs, within a governmental entity.
SQL Microsoft Suite including SQL Server and BI, Python, SAS, Oracle

West Virginia Courts

West Virginia has a Unified Court System,under which all state courts, including the Intermediate Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, Magistrate Courts, and Family Courts, are supervised and administered by the Supreme Court of Appeals. The Supreme Court of Appeals and its Administrative Office are located in Charleston and housed in the State Capitol Complex. More information about West Virginia’s Courts can be found on our website at www.courtswv.gov.

Equal Opportunity in Employment

It is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to provide equal opportunity in employment for all persons, and to recruit, select, train, promote, retain, and discipline without regard to race, color, sex, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin. Further, it is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to maintain a professional workplace in which individuals are accorded respect, and an environment free of harassment, including verbal or physical conduct that creates an intimidating or hostile environment for any individual on any prohibited basis. As an employer with an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Plan, the Court complies with government regulations and related Equal Employment Responsibilities where applicable.

Application Process

To apply for this position, please send the following completed Court Employment Application (available on Court website at www.courtswv.gov), along with a letter of interest highlighting applicable experience, and a resume, including references.

All positions of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia are considered at-will and may

be terminated at any time, with or without notice or cause.

Thank you for your interest in employment with the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Position Summary/Position

Under the direction of the Data Science Systems Manager, the Data Scientist II is responsible for modeling complex institutional problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database, and computing environments, and communicating results.
Collaborating closely with Data Science Developers, this role will partner with our business stakeholders to identify ways to augment and enhance our data in order provide insight beyond what can be gleaned from the data we have today.

Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities)

1. Lead and drive cross functional data science projects from beginning to end: build relationships with partner teams, frame and structure questions, collect and analyze data.
2. Apply descriptive and predictive analytics to help drive insights and business decisions.
3. Apply a diverse set of tactics such as statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning to research and produce insights.
4. Work with data engineering and data solutions teams to ensure proper data tracking is set up for features and support debugging and development of new ETL processes.
5. Build deep-dive analyses and eventually machine learning models to better forecast risk across the portfolio for our contracts and claims activity.
6. Support business operations, finance, quality systems, and other internal teams by building analytics and reporting to understand overall business performance and increase organizational efficiencies
7. Manage tests for specific provider and generate data to build out case studies and messaging strategies.
8. Designs experiments, test hypotheses, and build models.
9. Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithm.
10. Works with Institute stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
11. Works with and alongside business analysts by suggesting other products of interest to the client.
12. Models and frames business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions.
13. Collaborates with Institute subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information.
14. Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.
15. Provides on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of decision systems and statistical models.
16. Communicate analysis and decisions to high-level stakeholders and executives in verbal, visual, and written formats.
17. Collaborate with business leaders, subject matter experts, and decision makers to develop success criteria and optimize new solutions, features, policies, and models.
18. Demonstrate a commitment to support IEHP’s strategic priorities to become a 5-Star Health Plan and incorporate LEAN principles into daily work.

Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities) Cont

Supervisory Responsibilities

Leading: Self

Experience Qualifications

Four or more (4+) years of experience in analytics, data science, and business intelligence. Experience in developing algorithms, predictive analytics, or statistical models. Experience in analyzing large data sets that have complex designs that are unstructured, structured, and semi-structured. Proven ability to facilitate cross-functional projects that depend on the contributions of others in a variety of disciplines. Fluency with data warehouse design practices, analytics, and visualization technologies. Experience in the use of statistical packages.

Preferred Experience

Experience in the areas of medical or health services is preferred.

Education Qualifications

Master Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science, or related field from an accredited institution is required.

Preferred Education

Doctorate degree from an accredited institution preferred.

Professional Certification

Professional Licenses

Drivers License Required

No

Knowledge Requirement

Strong understanding of Machine Learning theory with significant applied experience. Strong scientific Python skills using pandas, scikit-learn, and statsmodels, as well as strong understanding of model deployment patterns. Manipulating large datasets and using database and general-purpose programming language (such as Hadoop MapReduce, Python, JavaScript, or other big data frameworks, Java). Familiarity with basic principles of distributed computing and/or distributed databases. Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theorems- and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas. Working knowledge of diagnosis and procedure coding, medical terminology, knowledge of managed care, claims payment processes, and insurance terminology required.

Skills Requirement

Strong analysis and critical thinking skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Excellent interpersonal/ communication skills.

Abilities Requirement

Ability to multi-task while maintaining careful attention-to-detail. Ability to handle multiple projects, data input, and strong problem-solving capability. Ability to build relationships and influence across the organization. Independent self-starter who is driven to success, takes great pride in accomplishments and works with a sense of urgency to meet deadlines and address competing priorities.

Commitment to Team Culture

The IEHP Team environment requires a Team Member to participate in the IEHP Team Culture. A Team Member demonstrates support of the Culture by developing professional and effective working relationships that include elements of respect and cooperation with Team Members, Members and associates outside of our organization.

Working Conditions

Word processing involving computer keyboard and screens. Willingness to be on call, 7x24x365 (less pre-approved exceptions) and attend to technical issues outside of normal business hours.
