Tasks: Utilize inquiry skills to obtain a clear understanding of business processes and needs. Work with stakeholders to determine value that additional information derived from proper analyses could provide Collaborate with Information Technology partners to develop data acquisition and data management practices.

Essential function: Provide meaningful, concise reporting of analytic results.
Tasks: Develop concise meaningful written reports and provide oral presentation of information. Develop reporting dashboards that meet business needs for status, trends, and variances Collaborate with IT and business units to operationalize meaningful reports and dashboards.

E-commerce healthcare training company seeks full-time Data Manager to lead our team in the processing, loading and quality checking the marketing leads we acquire and add to our database.

These qualified marketing prospects are the lifeblood of our company. You will have the important job of managing the processes and staff that are responsible for the capture, completion, and accuracy of all marketing prospects added to our system. This process supports our marketing team and drives the majority of our company’s revenue.

Your day-to-day duties will range from diving in and processing actual prospect records before they are loaded to setting strategic goals for your team to ensure our prospect database continues to grow.

Key Responsibilities:

Manage the acquisition, validation, tagging, and formatting of new email marketing prospects.
Work closely with marketing team to optimize prospect volume and results
Coordinate between departments to ensure deadlines are met
Prioritize data so that the highest quality prospects are processed first
Meet monthly volume and accuracy goals
Front-line management of data processing team of 2 (1 onsite and 1 offsite)
Audit work to ensure accuracy and quality of data before loading
When needed, jump in and process prospects with your team to ensure goals are met
Solve problems as they arise to keep prospects moving

Requirements:

Values: Buy in and to our company values
Experience: 3+ years’ experience as data project manager (or similar job), preferably supporting marketing functions
Computer: EXCELLENT MS Excel skills

MS Dynamics and SQL a massive plus, but not required.

Healthcare Knowledge: Although not completely necessary, it would be hugely beneficial
Details: Track numerous details under tight deadlines with minimal errors.
Change: Ability to shift gears quickly.
Location: North Naples office (partially remote may be possible after time)
Deadlines: Meet numerous deadlines
Management: Strong problem-solving, multitasking and prioritization skills. You never give up.
Communications: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Auditing: Ability to utilize key indicators to identify problems – then take action to resolve.
Strategy: Regularly examine current processes to identify opportunities to improve speed and accuracy.

Company Core Values: Own it, People Matter, Persistent Optimism, and Results

Our entire team moves fast and never shies away from a challenge. We are definitively a glass entirely full group. This doesn’t mean that we have our heads in the clouds. We live in reality, driven by data and numbers. When mistakes happen (which they do), we own them. Then, we use what we’ve learned and do it right the next time. We respect each other, but say what needs to be said. We work hard so we can have a balanced life. With that said, when we are here we are results-oriented and driven.

This role is a chance to use your talent and expertise to make a visible difference in our company growth. The opportunity to work with a dedicated, talented, fun team that love their jobs, thrive on results and really enjoy coming to work each day (life is too short to simply go through the motions). We even have a company dog (who is hypoallergenic).

We’re looking for a rock star to join our team that can make a real difference in our company success. So, if you have the skills and meet the requirements in this posting and if you want to work somewhere that appreciates you and the work you do, is fast-moving, positive and results driven – we would love to have you join our team!!!!

JOB SUMMARY

This role utilizes diverse skills to perform preventative maintenance and corrective repairs in a 24/7 Data Center operation working a 12-hr. shift schedule. The role also includes inspection of electrical and mechanical systems, including but not limited to: Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) systems, generators, chillers, Electrical Distribution, HVAC systems, and Building Management Systems (BMS) systems.

This position sits onsite in Altoona, Iowa.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform daily site inspections of all Mechanical & Engineering (M&E) systems and technical equipment, including servicing and maintenance. Under general supervision, complete assigned work according to established processes and procedures in accordance with CBRE's Environment, Health and Safety Policy - ensuring all safety processes and PPE requirements are followed. Also, ensure all regulatory requirements and quality standards are met. Oversee third-party vendors, ensuring compliance with CBRE's developed processes, procedures, and all applicable laws/regulations. Accompany vendors on site visits on an as needed basis and ensure site standards are met. Help create and develop work processes, Job Hazard Analysis reports, and SOPs for critical work with risk assessment. Complete all required training to ensure successful completion of all job-related responsibilities.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities are required in this position. Other tasks may require informal assistance such as providing technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. Additional coordination of work and assigning tasks may also be required, as needed.



QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma/GED required, with more than 2 years of experience in basic mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry preferred.
Knowledge of emergency response/standby/call out activities and protocols is a plus. Advanced training and experience in mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry is a plus but not required.
CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
None
COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Ability to perform basic math skills is essential. Basic knowledge of financial terms and principles is helpful.
REASONING ABILITY
Ability to understand and carry out general instructions and to perform problem solving in workplace situations. Basic analytical skills are essential.
OTHER SKILLS and/or ABILITIES
Ability to work in a 24/7 12-hr shift schedule environment. Shift schedules are generally consistent but are subject to change based on business need and continuity of operations.
Basic knowledge/skills in the use of personal computer and smartphone.
General knowledge/ability using Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, etc.).
Familiarity with instant messaging, text messaging and chats is a plus.
Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and together with coworkers in a team environment is essential.
Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.
SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions are made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Doing the right thing is expected of all employees.

Job_description:
Part-Time Data Entry Analyst - Solvas Financial Technology

Work you'll do
This is a part-time syndicated loan data entry analyst opportunity supporting the Solvas|Digitize Managed service. Job duties include:

Review syndicated loan notices for manual extraction and data input
Review automated data extraction results
Speed and accuracy when reviewing and/or inputting data
Ability to work independently and without direct supervision while adhering to strict deadlines
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills (both verbal and through email communication)
Excellent analytical skills, attention to detail, and strong organizational skills
This is temporary, hourly position with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. (EST), although other hours may be required based on business need.
Shifts are scheduled in minimum of 4 hour increments and a minimum of 8 hours is expected during peak days (typically 2 - 3 days per month)
The days worked per month are typically 3 to 10 days only. (This is not a regular part-time position and there are regular hours .) Working days are based exclusively on business needs and are expected to be variable.

The Team

Our Financial Technology practice develops and licenses a growing family of proprietary software products and service solutions (see www.deloitte.com/ft ) to assist financial institutions with a number of complex topics such as accounting for credit deteriorated assets and the administration of investments in leveraged loans.

We are looking to add professionals to support our Solvas|Digitize™ solution team ( www.solvasdigitize.com ). Solvas|Digitize is an intelligent automation solution and managed service that is experiencing rapid growth and expansion across various industries and applications.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or 1+ year of relevant work experience
Proficiency with all current technology and Microsoft Office 365 programs, including, but not limited to:
Laptop functionality
Video conferencing software (i.e. Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Skype)
Ability to utilize multiple web applications (at least 2) simultaneously
Microsoft Teams
Online software programs for data entry
Flexibility in terms of work hours and workdays is required
Ability to find specific data points based on guidance/logical reasoning
Syndicated loan experience is preferred, but is not required
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Washington State, Deloitte is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to Washington State and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current rate of pay is $20 per hour.

Other details:

Work timing

Part-time, hourly basis with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on specific days of each month based on business need. Occasional weekend and holiday coverage will be required.

Location

Any U.S. location will be considered for the appropriate candidate; team is located primarily in the New York, Dallas, and Houston metropolitan areas

Travel

Travel will be rare if required at all

Please do not apply unless you are a US Citizen, or a Green Card Holder AND you have SAP ABAP experience. Also, you must be located in South Florida, commuting distance to Hollywood FL, for this position because some work is office based.

This full-time position is based in our office in Florida, you will use your SAP ABAP development skills and be trained on one of the world's top data conversion platforms to enable you to migrate client data from various source systems including SAP to target systems including SAP S/4HANA.

Assist the Natuvion SAP Architects with data analysis (using SAP ABAP)
Using Natuvion’s and other industry products and techniques
With our customers and functional experts, define and configure, refine data extraction, deletion and splitting rules

Perform data extractions
Perform data mapping

Perform data validation and quality assurance across systems

- Ideally, you have a degree in computer science or programming with knowledge of at least one object-oriented programming language (e.g., SAP ABAP is mandatory, Java, Python). Experience with SAP and ABAP is mandatory. Experience with SAP Migration Cockpit, LSMW, EMIGALL etc or other tools is a plus.

We will invest in your visa if you wish to move to USA from Latin America or Germany.

Job_description:
Don't want to sit at a desk all day? Want to serve your community? Like managing your own time?

Join our team! No Experience required, paid training provided!

About Vision Government Solutions

Vision Government Solutions is a leading high-tech firm providing cutting-edge software and services to the public sector. Our organization is at an incredible inflection point and we are looking for people to join our data collection team.

Why This Opportunity is Different

This is an incredible opportunity to grow and develop a career as many of our senior leadership team members started at Vision as data collectors. Learn the appraisal business from the ground-up with the largest firm in Pennsylvania.

Job Description

Immediately hiring Data Collectors in Clarion County with reliable transportation who are dependable, customer-service oriented and enjoy working outdoors. In this role, you would be responsible for inspecting, verifying and recording details of commercial and residential properties required for property valuation.

If you are looking for an opportunity to advance your career - Vision Government Solutions is the place for you. Our team takes pride in their work and many successful candidates have enjoyed long-term career growth with our company. NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY - just dependability and a willingness to learn.

Job Responsibilities

Accurately record all required data on the collection form that will be pertinent to the valuation of the property.
Interact effectively and professionally with taxpayers to neutralize any misgivings on their part regarding the inspection process.
Anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.
Submit on a timely basis, accurate production and corresponding reports, such as timesheets, expense reports and other prescribed company documents.
Adhere to dress code.
Willing to travel to within Clarion County, PA.

Who We Are Looking For

The right person will have demonstrated the following skills and traits whether in their past or in the interview process:

Desire to learn and grow in the real estate appraisal field.
Incredible attention to detail to ensure only the most accurate data for later statistical analysis.
Strong communication skills with the ability to adapt to different stakeholders to ensure positive taxpayer experiences.
Exhibit the flexibility necessary to multi-task and perform contracted services in multiple communities as needed.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to anticipate unusual situations and make quick and responsible decisions.
Spatial ability to read maps and locate a physical location on a map.
Ability to visualize floor plan footprints based on three-dimensional buildings.
Good math skills to calculate square footage, ratios, and similar functions.

Physical Requirements:

Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time (8-hour workday). Bending, stretching, and kneeling are part of the daily routine.
Climbing stairs and the ability to carry 5-10 lbs. of equipment throughout the workday is required.
Ability to work outdoors for long periods of time.
Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable transportation.
Must be able to pass background/MVR check.

Training Opportunity

All necessary mass appraisal training will be provided to the right candidate. We are willing to train motivated, hardworking individuals. Most importantly, you should enjoy working outdoors, and demonstrate qualities of reliability, accuracy, and consistency.

Relevant Experience

High School Degree (Required)

Compensation

Pay starting at $17.00/hr.
Mileage reimbursement at $0.57 per mile
Flexible schedules
Benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision and 401(k) with company match
Vacation, sick, and holiday pay
On-site training
Opportunity to advance in the company

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY

Summary / Objective:

This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.

The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.

Essential Functions:

· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.

· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.

Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.

Competencies:

Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.
Ability to translate business needs into high-level technical specifications and design.
Working knowledge of EDI configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.
Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP.
Knowledge of state, federal and local regulations concerning use, disclosure and confidentiality of all patient records including a strong knowledge of the HIPAA Privacy and Security Act.

Required Education and/or Work Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.
5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI systems, preferably in a healthcare environment.
6 + years of experience in the development and/or support of software systems are required.
3+ years related experience including developing requirements, designing and executing test cases in IT
Hands-on X12 health care insurance transaction (834, 837, 270, 271, 999 etc.) data mapping and issue resolution experience
Experience with SQL, relational databases and Microsoft development tools, such as VB, VB Script, .NET or ASP.
Experience with QA methodology and problem-solving techniques/tools.
Experience with multi-tiered client-server and web-based applications.
Experience with working with developers and internal technical teams to develop and test EDI processes.

Preferred Education and/or Work Experience:

Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid.
Experience creating EDI processes “from the ground up” in a small to mid-sized organization.
Experience with applying Agile Methods.
Experience with healthcare claims and billing file types.

Understanding of health industry diagnosis, procedure and revenue codes and their application.
Experience writing complex SQL scripts.
Understanding of EDI 834 enrollment transactions, including Adds, Changes, Terminations, Cancellations, and error processing.

Company: Florida Department of Financial Services - Division of Rehabilitation and Liquidation
Job_description:
About Us

The Division of Rehabilitation and Liquidation (Division) is one of 13 divisions within the Florida Department of Financial Services. It serves as the Receiver of insurance companies that are placed in receivership, primarily for purposes of rehabilitation or liquidation. Under an order of rehabilitation, the Receiver seeks to remedy the problems that resulted in the company being placed into rehabilitation. In liquidation, the Receiver collects all assets of the company and ultimately distributes the available assets to claimants under a statutory prioritization. In both instances, the Receiver is responsible for conducting business on behalf of the company that has been placed in receivership. This process entails providing an array of services which include Accounting, Asset Recovery, Claims, Legal, Information Technology, Administrative Services and Estate Management functions.

Position Summary:

The Division is seeking a Senior Database Analyst. This position is responsible for performing complex analysis of database systems including planning, design, maintenance, and development. The duties and responsibilities of this position include the following:

Performs company data analysis and conversion into Division’s systems. Coordinates with receivership company IT staff to obtain necessary data.
Coordinates data transmissions from Division’s systems to external entities (e.g. Guaranty Associations).
Identifies data sources, constructs data decomposition diagrams, provides data flow diagrams and documents the process.
Develops reusable code and procedures to streamline data conversion and insure data quality.
Develops integration between internal business applications at the database level.
Evaluates user's request for new data elements and systems against the existing shared data environment.
Coordinates use of the organization's data to ensure data integrity and control redundancy.
Establishes database design techniques using data modeling and prototyping software.
Analyzes and proposes changes to database structures.
Develops and maintains data dictionary ensuring uniformity of definitions and standards for use of data dictionary.
Works with infrastructure team to determine necessary database security.
Travels as required.
Support disaster recovery efforts.
Performs other related duties as required.

Salary Range:

The hiring salary range for this position is$70,000.00 – $80,000.00 per year.

Minimum Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer engineering, management information systems, information systems, engineering, or mathematics and three years of experience in database design and development, computer software development, management information systems, web design, information systems; or
Professional experience as described may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required education.

Preferences:

Preference may be given to applicants with experience in one or more of the following areas:

Microsoft SQL Server and SQL scripting
Relational database design and development
Data analysis and conversion techniques
Extensive knowledge of data integration and processing including extraction, transformation and loading.
Data Quality system/software from Informatica or similar Data Quality tool
Microsoft Visual Studio programming

Employment Requirements:

In compliance with federal law, individuals selected for hire will be required to confirm their identity and eligibility to work in the United States.
In accordance with Florida Statutes 110.1128, the Division must verify male applicants have registered with the Selective Service System or have proof of registration exemption to be eligible for employment or promotion with the Division. If registration or exemption cannot be verified, male applicants are not eligible for hire. If currently employed by the Division, this law prohibits the promotion of such person. This requirement also applies to any male who has legally or illegally entered the United States. To check the status of your registration, obtain proof of exemption, review requirements for transgender people, or for general information about the Selective Service System, please visit www.sss.gov.

Why Join Our Team?

The vision of the Receiver is to be a recognized and respected leader in the efficient administration of insurance receiverships. To accomplish this goal, the Receiver is comprised of a talented workforce that is dedicated to providing quality service that maximizes value for the public. Joining our team will provide the opportunity to experience the following benefits:

A welcoming and open environment that fosters a sense of belonging, purpose and innovation.
Meaningful and challenging work that improves the quality of life for the citizens of Florida.
Shared values of service, teamwork, excellence, accountability, diversity, innovation and integrity.
A comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life and other supplemental insurances, retirement and flexible spending accounts, front-loaded paid time off, and more.
A culture that supports flexible work schedules, community service and the recognition of employee contributions.
A commitment to training and development through continuous education and collaboration.

For more information, please visit our website at http://www.myfloridacfo.com/division/receiver/.

How to Apply:

Resumes can be submitted through one of the below methods. The information must be received by the position’s closing date and time.

Mail or Hand Delivery: 325 John Knox Road, Atrium Building Suite 101, Tallahassee, Florida 32303.
If you require an accommodation to participate in the application process due to a disability, please call (850) 413-4546 for assistance.

Business Analyst

Department: Application Support

Location: 302 Main Street Catskill, NY 12414

Reports to: VP, Application Support Officer

Supervises: None

Grade:

FLSA: Exempt

Position Purpose

The Business Analyst is responsible for the review, analyze, and evaluate processes, systems, and user needs for planned projects based on the business plan. The Business Analyst is involved in the development of business cases, facilitation of analysis workshops, the selection of the most effective solution and the definition and management of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure operational and IT deliverables meet the requirements of the Bank.

The Business Analyst assists the IT staff in understanding the Bank’s operational needs for both automated and manual solutions to business systems and procedures. The analyst is involved in planning, organizing, and conducting detailed management analytical studies to define problems, identify deficiencies and improve solutions which impact the Bank’s effectiveness and provide the basis for management decision.

Problems and Challenges

The relationship between the Bank, its internal functions, and relationships with its customers and suppliers is within the scope of this position. A working knowledge of the computer hardware and operating system software, which is the center of the Bank’s information technology and business services activities, must be understood by the business analyst. It is extremely important to the Bank that the business services systems offer the highest reliability and performance possible. The business analyst is challenged to assist the Bank in maintaining, upgrading, and troubleshooting the business services solutions that are or could be implemented.

Essential Position Functions

Principal Accountabilities

Performs requirements gathering and analysis to include: analytical techniques, interview techniques, data gathering techniques, current system documentation, business modeling methods, business process, rules and logic, data gathering to solve complex issues, development of implementation plans, development of requirements, JAD sessions and key analytical troubleshooting.
Partners with users to gather all requirements to formulate business specifications and translating those into business functionality.
Work with users to create solutions that support Key Performance Indicators (KPI) within the using organization.
Documenting workflows and results of business analysis and obtaining sign-off from users on specifications.
Assists the technical team in translating application functionality into application architecture and the production of a business functionality requirements statement.
Communicates the business directives, goals, and needs to the technical team and serving as a business interface from the Bank’s operational management team managing expectations and defining business satisfaction metrics.
Designs and executes test plans to ensure that business requirements and functional specifications are implemented properly and meet ROI objectives.
Understands the long-term business objectives and suggesting strategies to meet those objectives; introducing innovation to business processes through technology if appropriate.
Assists the staff in developing content or other materials; recommending enhancements and identifying new business requirements
Applies knowledge of system capacity to determine the feasibility of projects.
Maintains current knowledge of new hardware and software and recommends upgrading to maintain efficient operation.
Works with IT team and programmers, as necessary.
Performs analysis of department production and redesigns workflow if appropriate.
Develops, edits, and maintains operating procedures and standards manuals.
Serves as a business analyst in work measurement, system studies or cost/effectiveness analysis.
Directs the activities of the Forms/Graphic Designer and departmental secretarial support in maintaining an effective user-support relationship.
Aids as required to organizations outside of the Bank to improve internal procedures that may be advantageous to the Bank.
Conducts training sessions to implement new or improved systems and procedures.
Conducts meetings at all management levels for presentations, reviews, approvals of recommendations, etc.
Performs at or above performance standard and specifically for procedures development and analysis.
Assumes additional responsibilities as assigned.
Recognizes and identifies potential areas where existing Bank services policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed, and make recommendations in these areas.
Fulfills departmental requirements in providing work coverage and administrative notification during periods of personal illness, vacation, or education.

Authority

Structure priorities of function to be completed.
Initiate policies and procedures.
Monitor and analyze business services system performance.
Develop and maintain business services system problem analysis and resolution techniques.
Analyze and resolve problems quickly and efficiently as they relate to Bank services.
Support applications and operations with business management relating to the business services area.
Evaluate the hardware and software vendor and third-party hardware and software and report significant findings regarding business services applications to the Information Technology Team.
Evaluate cloud computing providers and solutions.

Contacts

This position requires contact with business and IT support personnel within the Bank. Within the bank, contacts will be made with application and operations staff, and occasionally with Bank personnel outside of IT for troubleshooting and the development of specifications relating to business services software.

Position Requirements

Personal qualities: resourcefulness, responsibility, tenacity, independence, energy, and self-confidence, strong analytical skills, solid business judgment, creativity, and the ability to communicate effectively with executive management
Strongly prefer a BS or BA level degree in computer science, business administration, operations engineering, or related field
5 years of supervisory, administrative or systems procedures analysis experience, three in the business services area is required as well
Experience in areas of Banking operations (i.e. work simplification, work measurement techniques/skills)
Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing
Analytical and organizational skills
Ability to work independently with limited supervision
Knowledge of office automation, Information Technology techniques, and practices, forms, and records management
Ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.

This is temporary, hourly position with core hours between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. (EST), although other hours may be required based on business need.
Shifts are scheduled in minimum of 4 hour increments and a minimum of 8 hours is expected during peak days (typically 2 - 3 days per month)
The days worked per month are typically 3 to 10 days only. (This is not a regular part-time position and there are regular hours .) Working days are based exclusively on business needs and are expected to be variable.

The Team

Our Financial Technology practice develops and licenses a growing family of proprietary software products and service solutions (see www.deloitte.com/ft ) to assist financial institutions with a number of complex topics such as accounting for credit deteriorated assets and the administration of investments in leveraged loans.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

Government Grant Data Analyst/Database Administrator, works under the general supervision of the Director of Grants. This role is responsible for creation of reports, dashboards, and other visualizations on data associated with grant awards and projects and business processes to provide insights in support of decision-making efforts. The Grant Data Analyst works as a liaison with departments and Elected Officials to coordinate data capture of all direct and subrecipient data and required reporting. The Analyst also coordinates the capture, transfer, sharing, integration and implementation of data systems, add-ons, plug-ins and bridges. This role is responsible for coordination of database and repository centralizing all federal awards.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBLITIES

Analyzing data using statistical techniques and providing reports. Developing and implementing databases and data collection systems. Acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and maintain data systems Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and cleaning data Maintain record of all grant operating department business processes and controls Suggest and implement approved tracking mechanisms to assist in convergence of data from current spreadsheets to database and upcoming ERP system. Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities Evaluates financial reports and performance reports makes escalate concerns to management regarding trends and potential negative impacts. Assist in the evaluation of the effectiveness of grants, compliance with federal regulations, federal agencies, and specific grant contract provisions. Monitors funded projects to prevent over-expenditure of funds; audit disallowance and ensure awards are fully expended. Evaluates grant expenditure agreements to differentiate between sub-recipients or contractors. Analyzes internal and external financial reports, including single audits. Assist in the set-up of electronic database and repository. Maintains electronic database and repository for efficient data collection and report production. Monitors and report the spending of awards, budget adjustments, contract amendments, grant match and cost allocation plans. Assists in the reduction and elimination of findings and questions regarding costs. Performs special project analysis as requested. Reconciles reported revenues and expenditures to the general ledger for grant and prepares the necessary journal entries for correction and posting. Communicates reminders to departments receiving monies of report submission deadlines and when the grant period will expire and/or when an extension maybe needed. Coordinate with external auditors for financial or audit support requests. Other duties as assigned by the Division Director of Grants and Contracts.

JOB SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and governmental accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.
Administration and Management Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Mathematics Knowledge of arithmetic and their applications. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc), Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Customer and Personal Service Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
English Language Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.
Grant Lifecycle Knowledge of the linear lifecycle that includes discovering, creating and programing the funding opportunity, applying, making award decisions, and successfully implementing the award.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, or related field and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
(5-6) years of professional accounting experience, governmental preferred, with a minimum of (4) years of grant administration, data analytics and auditing of state funded grant programs, within a governmental entity.
SQL Microsoft Suite including SQL Server and BI, Python, SAS, Oracle

Under guidance from the Director of Information Technology, the Business Analyst II position has primary responsibility for the operation, troubleshooting, and maintenance of the College’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and its integrations with external systems to support the College’s business processes. This position is primarily distinguished from the Business Analyst I position in that it has primarily responsibility in many areas and requires a higher degree of technical expertise.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Participate in the regular operation of the ERP system by:
Creating and maintaining the Production Calendar
Executing tasks assigned to IT in the Production Calendar
Chairing the ERP Steering Committee
Performing advanced user account management, including creating new roles and modifying permissions for existing roles
Creating and modifying complex reports
Creating and maintaining documentation of existing business processes and technical workflows
Assist with first-level support for business process and technical workflow issues within the ERP system and, when necessary, escalating business process issues to vendor support or consultants and technical workflow issues to the Systems Programmer Analyst
Participate in initiatives and projects to improve, upgrade, and create new functionality within the ERP system by:
Analyzing existing business processes to identify opportunities for automation or otherwise improving efficiency
Developing Functional Requirements for business processes and Technical Requirements for technical workflow
Serving on ERP-related project teams throughout the project lifecycle:
Initiation
Planning
Executing (in both test and production environments)
Monitoring and Controlling (largely through User Acceptance Testing)
Closing
Training users on the implementation of new or improved processes within the ERP system
Keeping abreast of vendor roadmaps, emerging technologies, and changes in requirements within the California Community College system
As needed, assist or backup the Systems Analyst Programmer

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree OR Associate’s Degree and a minimum of two year’s equivalent experience in business analysis
Knowledge of and experience with:
Business processes associated with Accounting, Admissions and Records, Financial Aid, Human Resources, and\or Student Services
Microsoft Office applications, particularly Word and Excel
Business analysis tools and techniques such as Business Process Modeling (BPM) and SWOT
Database Management Systems such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server
Enterprise reporting and scheduling tools
Required skills:
Customer service
Written communications
Multi-tasking\time management
Troubleshooting skills, such as research, reasoning, analysis, and decision-making
Work collaboratively within teams
Work independently after receiving direction

Knowledge of and experience with:
Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems
Student Information Systems, such as Banner
Academic Advising software, such as DegreeWorks
Learning Management Systems, such as Canvas
Programming and scripting languages, including Structure Query Language (SQL)
Desired skills:
Training and certifications in:
Business Analysis
Project Management
Oral communications

Overview of Business Analyst

The Department of Reporting and Operational Intelligence at Purdue University Northwest is seeking a Business Analyst. As the Business Analyst, you will assist in the support and oversight of the daily overall Customer Relationship Management system (CRM) functionality. Under the direction of the Assistant Vice Chancellor of Student Success Technologies, the position will assist in leveraging modern technologies in a way that improves operational efficiencies, user experience, and student experience.

Duties and Responsibilities of Business Analyst
Stay abreast of new technologies and enhancements to existing solutions
Working closely with Assistant Vice Chancellor of Student Success Technologies and Sr. Business and Information Analyst to see projects move from conception to completion, collect feedback from users to set priorities, and fostering a collaborative work environment within Enrollment Management and Student Affairs (EMSA).
Along with helping to identify opportunities for improving business processes through the use of technology to eliminate problems that affect productivity and data output.
Work with Information Services to provide a reporting infrastructure for ongoing development of a suite of reports and dashboards to support data driven decisions and operational data clean-up to ensure accurate and valid data.
Support all areas of EMSA in providing ad hoc reporting data for daily operational needs.
Work with all areas within EMSA to assist with validating data within reports.
Assist with supporting intuitional compliance with federal state, Purdue University systems, and NCAA rules, regulations and policies.
Oversee application and implementation of regulatory releases and updates from the functional perspective
Coordinate testing of all EMSA modules by developing and maintaining functional testing plans for system upgrades, changes, etc.



Benefits of Business Analyst
Full benefits – Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term Disability, Retirement, Life Insurance and more
Accrue 15 days’ vacation your first year, then 22 days’ vacation your 2nd year plus rollover
University contribution of 10% to retirement (3 year waiting period)
University contributions to Health Savings Account –
Plus a chance to earn more through participating in University Wellness Initiatives
10 paid holidays
Employee Wellness Programs
Paid Parental Leave after one year of service
Tuition remission for you, your spouse and dependent children at any Purdue campus

For more information on our excellent benefit package, please visit: https://www.pnw.edu/human-resources/benefits/

Purdue University Northwest (PNW) is a premier metropolitan university dedicated to empowering transformational change in our students and in our community. We offer two campuses serving approximately 8,800 undergraduate and graduate students. At PNW, we value academic excellence, support growth, and celebrate diversity.

PNW sits between Chicago’s skyscrapers and Lake Michigan’s sandy shores. You can have all the perks of a world-class city just a short drive away or enjoy the natural beauty of the Indiana Dunes National Park and Lake Michigan just 15 miles away.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field

2 years Higher Education experience

High analytical skills and attention to detail with an emphasis on business process improvement, data analysis and oversight in the completion of comprehensive testing in preparation for the implementation of software patches/upgrades
Ability to think strategically and implement new processes, concepts, or office efficiencies leveraging modern technologies such as CRM (Technolutions Slate)
CRM, or Student Information System such as Banner experience

Ability to think creatively and quickly to resolve system and process issues
Displays a high level of conscientiousness and follow-through
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (both verbal and written)
Strong analysis skills
Ability to work effectively with people with differing levels of technical knowledge
Demonstrated understanding of Enrollment Management Systems
Professional demeanor and works well with others

Professional references will be verified prior to any offer of employment. Employment is contingent upon completion of successful background check along with a motor vehicle records check if applicable.

My name is Alicia. I’m the hiring manager for this position, and I welcome you to join our Emerson family as a Business Data Analyst!

This role will be a great opportunity not only for you to learn cutting edge technologies and techniques, but for you to make a tremendous impact by providing insights that will shape the way we do business.

I believe part of my role as a Manager is to help my employees grow, and to provide the tools and opportunities they need to achieve their goals and objectives.

Professional development is something I am very passionate about, and as part of the role, you will have opportunities for Professional Development, Mentorship, training and Certifications.

If you love to learn, grow and be challenged and if you have a passion for shaping the future, then this role may be for you!

Position Summary:

As a Business Data Analyst, you will have an integral role in adding value and making an impact to the organization by providing meaningful insights that drive business decision-making.

You will use cutting edge technology to transform data into information for analysis in a user-friendly format. You will search out critical data for better definition, conduct analysis with current quantitative techniques, and provide recommendations to enable Flow Controls to better understand its business and market.

In this role, you will work with professionals throughout the organization in a collaborative setting to solve business needs across North America.

AS A BUSINESS DATA ANALYST, YOU WILL:

Support Sales, Operations and Planning with forecasts based on market analysis of customer, market, and company data
Collect, analyze, and evaluate data turning it into usable information that can be interpreted into business intelligence
Partner with key stakeholders to obtain market (Customer, Competitor, and Flow Controls) information
Collaborate with team members to provide effective solutions for our data needs
Create data visualization tools for our business to make intelligent decisions
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Actively participate in continuous improvement activities to support business performance
Devise methods to collect and categorize customer, competitor, and Flow Controls data
Identify data errors and make appropriate adjustments to ensure data accuracy
Other duties as assigned by Manager
Demonstrate commitment to Service Level Doctrine and Safety Culture
REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, IT or Business
Desire and ability to learn new technologies.
Critical thinker with a passion for solving problems.
Self-starter comfortable working independently with limited direction
Legal authorization to work in the United States
PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
0-5 years of related experience
Business metric analysis
Must display strong mathematical skills to collect, measure, organize, and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, R, Python
Knowledge of data visualization software like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets
General machine learning experience in topics like regression modeling or classification
Express a systematic and logical approach to problem solving
Must show accuracy and attention to detail
Must display creativity and ability for critical thinking
Must have excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Must possess a process improvement and problem-solver mentality
Ability to work effectively in teams and interact with all levels of the organization
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet various deadlines
Clearly understand integrated financial systems and the Microsoft Office Suite

Position Details



Portland Public Schools (PPS) is seeking talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences to lead change and inspire PPS students. At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. With the District’s focus on eliminating systemic racism and its adverse impact on student learning, we seek to hire individuals who bring to our district a deep commitment to racial equity and social justice. To learn more about Portland Public Schools, please visit the District website: here

POSITION SUMMARY:

Portland Public Schools Human Resources Department is seeking a Data Analyst I – HRIS. We are seeking someone who is a team player, takes initiative, and has strong attention to detail. This position will be responsible for complex data entry and auditing. If you are a great communicator, organized, flexible, technically savvy and like to problem solve, please apply.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

The classification specification does not describe all duties performed by all incumbents within the class. This summary provides examples of typical tasks performed in this classification.

Process and analyze all personnel transactions in the PeopleSoft system, including new hires, transfers, promotions, resignations, and retirements.
Interpret, analyze, research, and verify information from Portland Public Schools source documents or computer systems.
Manage the Position Management module in PeopleSoft HRMS
Includes creating new positions and updating existing positions.
Interpret, research, confirm and enter position attributes including reporting structure, and position subject information from PPS Source Documents/Systems.
Includes day-to-day position changes and maintenance, as well as comprehensive projects (e.g. school closures or group reclassifications).
Run position management and HRIS reports to audit and ensure data integrity.
Responsible for weekly licensure monitoring of licensed employees in the District and process renewal documents and communicating with Teaching Standards and Practice Commission (TSPC), Oregon state licensing agency.
Perform monthly and as-needed audits of employee data and complete data corrections.
Support HRIS system business process improvement, documentation, and training.
Perform other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION AND TRAINING:

Completion of a Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field is required.

EXPERIENCE:

Human Resources Data Analyst I – a minimum of one (1) year of experience working with human resources, payroll or information technology experience as an application administrator, business analyst or data entry analyst is required.

Any other combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities may be considered.

Experience in a richly diverse K-12 public school district or public agency is desirable.

Experience with Peoplesoft is desirable.

Takes initiative, team player, ability to analyze and problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills, organized, flexible and technically savvy are desirable.

Remote Work Eligibility: Full remote

CLASSIFICATION AND SALARY:

This position is classified as HR HRIS Data Analyst I, Pay Grade 19, on the Non-Represented, Confidential, Professional and Management Employees salary schedule FLSA Non-Exempt.

For a full Classification Specification, please see here.

The Non-Represented Confidential Professional Management and Employees Salary Schedule for 260 day employees can be found here.




Benefits Information



Portland Public Schools (PPS) offers several competitive and comprehensive benefit packages to employees. Fringe benefits include medical, dental, vision, prescription, life and disability insurance, employee assistance program, 403(b) retirement savings plan and various leave and professional development programs. Depending on the insurance option selected by the employee, there may be an employee contribution toward insurance.

Portland Public Schools is a public employer and participates in the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS/OPSRP). Eligible employees are required by statute to contribute 6% of salary on a pre-tax basis to OPSRP/IAP, after serving six months under a PERS employer.

For more information about additional benefits or compensation options by employee group, please visit our website at: https://www.pps.net/Page/1635

About us:

From building entire infrastructures or platforms to solving complex IT challenges, Cambridge Technology helps businesses accelerate their digital transformation and become AI-first businesses. With over 20 years of expertise as a technology services company, we enable our customers to stay ahead of the curve by helping them figure out the perfect approach, solutions, and ecosystem for their business. Our experts help customers leverage the right AI, big data, cloud solutions, and intelligent platforms to help them become and stay relevant in a rapidly changing world.

CT Labs is currently looking for highly motivated individuals.

CT Labs is Cambridge's in-house team responsible for curating and incubating intellectual capital for future products and managed services, e.g., operationalized AI and the Digital Twin of Operations (DToO) platform. We participate in client engagements as part of our curation and incubation process. In addition, we leverage and integrate vendor tools and industry standards to create proofs-of-concept and the technical foundation for future commercial offerings.

Skills Required :

The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's/master's/Ph.D. in data science, statistics, or related discipline with 3-5 years of experience or a master's degree with 2-3 years of experience. A strong candidate will also possess many of the following characteristics.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on achieving proof-of-concept
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts (regression, statistical tests, etc.)
Knowledge of machine learning and deep learning fundamentals
Experience with Python implementations to build ML and deep learning algorithms (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, stats models, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)
Experience writing and debugging code in an IDE
Experience using managed web services (e.g., AWS, GCP, etc.)
Strong analytic and communications skills
Curiosity, flexibility, creativity, and a strong tolerance for ambiguity
Ability to learn new tools from documentation and internet resources
Ability to work from home with up to 20% travel to client sites

Roles and responsibilities :

You will work on a small, core team alongside other engineers and business leaders throughout Cambridge with the following responsibilities:
Collaborate with client-facing teams to design and build operational AI solutions for client engagements.
Identify relevant data sources for data wrangling and EDA.
Identify model architectures to use for client business needs.
Build full-stack data science solutions up to MVP that can be deployed into existing client business processes or scaled up based on clear documentation.
Present findings to teammates and key stakeholders in a precise and repeatable manner
Technologies will include MLOps, Testing and Machine learning platforms (e.g., Domino Data lab, Dataiku, Amazon Sage Maker, and Vertex Ai ), Python, and AI/ML using PyTorch and other MLOps tools for AI/ML at scale.

Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100thanniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.

POSITION SUMMARY

Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education or Formal Training

Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.

Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)

Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.

Knowledge, Skill and Ability

Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.

Experience

At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.

About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado

Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Data Governance Director

This role is a leadership position, reporting directly to VP level leader of the organization, and is responsible and accountable for leading a team that:

Develops, implements, and enforces organization-wide data governance activities with a focus on establishing and ensuring adherence to the enterprise data governance framework.
Develops a Master Data Management (MDM) strategy inclusive of a data catalog that simplifies data definitions and discovery providing for consistency across platforms and the enterprise.
Responsible for technology that governs structured, multi-structured, and unstructured data across data warehouses and other physical and virtual repositories.
Partners with key stakeholders for results.

Duties and Responsibilities

Full data governance framework ownership for the enterprise inclusive of, people, process, policies, and technology; manage the budget.
Recruit and build a dynamic team of talented analysts and specialists that are “comfortable being uncomfortable” and taking ownership in an ever-changing environment.
Identify, analyze, and leverage utility industry best practices, benchmark studies, and business relationships to measure and improve business processes.
Own and lead the data architecture and related structure.
Work with key stakeholders across the enterprise to enhance functional effectiveness and provide faster business value delivery.
Proactively manage risks and provide optimal performance and throughput.
Provide centralized oversight of data governance for the enterprise to empower users to make faster and smarter decisions.
Provide oversight to assigned project/ program resource or leads large complex initiatives, collaborating with business leaders and managing program delivery across internal IT, third-party vendors, and service providers.
Continued and progressive development and mentorship/coaching.

Required Qualifications for Position

Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, data science, mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering, or a related business or quantitative discipline.
10+ years total experience.
3+ years of direct leadership experience building and managing high-performing teams.
Demonstrated ability to initiate and maintain strategic stakeholder relationships to advance business goals.
Experienced navigating matrixed organizations. Proven ability to work departments collaboratively to resolve issues, drive projects to closure, achieve, desired results and successfully implement change.
Strong data governance project management background, with deep knowledge of data quality management, data integration, and data management.
Proficiency with data management or metadata management technology products.
Working knowledge of databases and database structures to enable articulating data concepts between business-focused, functional, and technical data users.
Strong program and project management experience with a proven track record of leading cross-functional IT/Business transformation programs.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously and at times competing deliverables.
Inclusive leadership style by proactively seeking out different perspectives both internally and externally.

Preferred Qualifications for Position

Experience leading data governance programs.
Advanced degree in Data Science, Math, MBA, or other related preferred.
Demonstratable experience leading cross-functional teams.
Experience in the roll-out and adoption of governance tools such as Alation, Collibra, Informatica, or Microsoft Purview.
Capable of negotiating and leveraging the influence of operational teams on data management improvement actions.
PMP certification and/or extensive project management experience.

JOB SUMMARY

This role utilizes diverse skills to perform preventative maintenance and corrective repairs in a 24/7 Data Center operation working a 12-hr. shift schedule. The role also includes inspection of electrical and mechanical systems, including but not limited to: Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) systems, generators, chillers, Electrical Distribution, HVAC systems, and Building Management Systems (BMS) systems.

This position sits onsite in Altoona, Iowa.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform daily site inspections of all Mechanical & Engineering (M&E) systems and technical equipment, including servicing and maintenance. Under general supervision, complete assigned work according to established processes and procedures in accordance with CBRE's Environment, Health and Safety Policy - ensuring all safety processes and PPE requirements are followed. Also, ensure all regulatory requirements and quality standards are met. Oversee third-party vendors, ensuring compliance with CBRE's developed processes, procedures, and all applicable laws/regulations. Accompany vendors on site visits on an as needed basis and ensure site standards are met. Help create and develop work processes, Job Hazard Analysis reports, and SOPs for critical work with risk assessment. Complete all required training to ensure successful completion of all job-related responsibilities.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No formal supervisory responsibilities are required in this position. Other tasks may require informal assistance such as providing technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. Additional coordination of work and assigning tasks may also be required, as needed.



QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
High School Diploma/GED required, with more than 2 years of experience in basic mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry preferred.
Knowledge of emergency response/standby/call out activities and protocols is a plus. Advanced training and experience in mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and carpentry is a plus but not required.
CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES
None
COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Job_description:
Description
VP of Sales

The Vice President of Sales is responsible for acquiring new accounts and achieving overall revenue growth.
The position requires excellent communication skills including in-person, phone and writing skills.
The goal of this position is to offer clients and prospects a new perspective on how they can best utilize our SaaS solutions. This will be accomplished by having an in-depth understanding of an account’s business, what brings them value and leveraging that information to deliver an irresistible message.

Candidates will teach prospects about how our solutions will benefit them and will tailor their communication to suit different prospects. The candidate will demonstrate expert knowledge regarding our suite of products and services and their useful application across various Public Finance Capital
Markets participants, including the Sell-side and Buy-side.

The VP-Sales will manage the sales cycle from cold-calling through contract negotiation and closing, with a bit of ongoing client account management when needed.

This position works closely with, and will report to the President of the company.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Networks and partners with customers - both over phone and in person - to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages the territory by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals of managing renewals as well as developing both cross-sell and new business sales opportunities when needed.
Uses appropriate interpersonal skills to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, and internal resources; communicates and interacts effectively with internal

Operations and Product teams to achieve company revenue goals.

Exhibits solid knowledge of the Capital Markets, both Sell-side and Buy-Side, and has experience selling data, technology and software services into this marketplace, knowledge of Municipal

Bond Markets is a big plus.

Knowledge of Product Management Lifecycle and the effort required to bring new so lutions to market.

Responsibilities

Generate new business sales by in person visits, as well as phone and web meetings.
Demonstrate the value of products and solutions to both new prospects and existing clients
Obtains territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Manage and coordinate all customer-related issues
Uses Salesforce to manage sales cycle pipeline and participate in weekly sales performance reports discussions
